documents: vaughan ready for south africa skipper michael vaughan is relieved england tour of zimbabwe passed off without major incident and is now relishing the prospect of south africa vaughan men who fly to johannesburg on monday cruised to series win over the zimbabweans but expect five tough tests against graeme smith side the zimbabwe tour didn start very well but we came through it he said but m quite happy to be leaving and going onto johannesburg for what is the exciting leg of the winter the england captain said he hoped to take the batting form he has shown in zimbabwe into the long tour of south africa vaughan was man of the series as zimbabwe were swept with runs at an average in excess of he said realise need to improve my oneday stats hopefully can take this form into test series in south africa and the seven oneday games it was convincing series win the boys did well in difficult situations vaughan said the youngsters who had filled in for some notable absentees had acquitted themselves well he said it was tour where we gave opportunity to few players and they have come in and done very good job it makes the selectors job little bit harder because we are producing good pool of players england six oneday specialists kevin pietersen darren gough vikram solanki ian bell matt prior and alex wharf will fly home to heathrow on monday night the remainder of the party will link up with the other members of the test squad in johannesburg in preparation for the first test starting in port elizabeth on december meanwhile vaughan admitted he was disappointed baffled and saddened by the absence of the zimbabwe rebels from the controversial series when you see heath streak sitting watching you in the stands it is disappointing zimbabwe aren putting their best team on the field vaughan said d like to have played against the flower brothers andy and grant heath streak and stuart carlisle all of those guys streak said he felt zimbabwean cricket would have been in better shape if the rebels were still involved there are some talented players in this team and we could have formed strong combination with them you don enjoy watching your country lose badly he said still have lot of friends in the changing room don have any issues with the players my issues are with zimbabwe cricket and the behaviour of some of the board members zimbabwe captain tatenda taibu admitted we are not quite there yet we need bit of experience and the more games we play the better we become we are just getting individual performances on the day but we have to play good cricket for overs and we have to get it together in game and we really haven done that and really have to work on that m very lucky that have bunch of young guys who really want to play for their country and give their best

documents: world xi triumph in tsunami match tsunami appeal match melbourne icc world xi beat asian xi by runs ricky ponting hit in massive total of after electing to bat first in front of crowd of rahul dravid topscored with not out in the asian xi reply after virender sehwag brisk daniel vettori took while england darren gough took wicket and catch shane warne had the game broadcast in countries to an estimated global television audience of one billion has already raised nearly xcxa million for the relief effort australian prime minister john howard tossed coin to start the match and afterwards the international cricket council chief executive malcolm speed paid tribute to the players for taking part he said this signifies the game compassion and commitment to provide as much help as possible to enable the survivors of the tsunami to rebuild their lives so far as this is possible ponting entertained the fans early on by hitting some big shots off anil kumble and abdul razzaq and the world xi run rate was soon ticking along at healthy rate chris cairns and brian lara enjoyed themselves as middle order packed with stars delivered the goods and there was plenty of time for the unorthodox australia tailender glenn mcgrath batted at number six where he fell for golden duck muttiah muralitharan captured his wicket in overall figures of it was welcome comeback performance from the sri lankan who had been out injured for five months and who was almost caught up in the december tragedy sehwag gave the asian xi good start as they reached in the th over but wickets regularly tumbled once he fell to catch in the deep trying to hit warne second ball for six vettori got stuck into the middle order where dravid played lone hand with only kumar sangakkara gough sole victim providing any meaningful support the world xi were further boosted by the presence of steve waugh as substitute fielder towards the end of the match it was all wrapped up in the th over with the run out of murali for duck man of the match ponting said the whole day has been very very special it great that the cricket community around the world can play huge part to raise some money to put smile on some faces around the world asian xi captain sourav ganguly said hope we have contributed in whatever way we can to help the people who have suffered this disaster sourav ganguly documents: shoaib ruled out of test series fast bowler shoaib akhtar will miss pakistan test series in india because he is still troubled by hamstring injury and cannot be considered he suffered the injury in australia last month and says his recovery will take another four to five weeks the squad for india will be named on saturday but he was quoted as saying don want to play half fit the news comes less than hours after he was fined xcxa for breaching the terms of his contract in australia he was accused of visiting nightclubs and talking to the media without permission but denies the charges and has lodged an appeal against the decision of disciplinary panel however shoaib insisted his decision to pull out of the test series had nothing to do with the outcome of the disciplinary hearing my decision is not linked to the fine or warning he said it is an honest decision since don want to go half fit to india shoaib absence will be huge blow to pakistan chances of avenging last year home test series defeat by india but he still hopes to be available for the six oneday internationals which follow the test matches have informed the pakistan cricket board of my decision and will inform them as soon as get fit so if the team needs me at that stage am available would love to play the oneday series provided the team needs me he added the yearold known as the rawalpindi express is the quickest bowler in world cricket and has been clocked at mph but his fitness record has been poor and he has missed of the tests pakistan have played since he made his debut in november shoaib believes injuries are an inevitable part of the game for fast bowlers because of the amount of international cricket nowadays but critics point to the fact that he has increased his workload by agreeing contracts with english counties he had spells with durham in and is due to play for worcestershire in the second half of the season following tour to the west indies pakistan meanwhile are awaiting fitness reports on fellow seamers mohammad sami mohammad khalil and shabbir ahmed before finalising their squad for india another paceman umar gul will definitely not make the trip because he is still undergoing rehabilitation following stress fractures in his back

Label: cricket
documents: icc ponders oneday alterations the rules of oneday cricket could be changed to allow the fielding side to take two wickets off single ball striking batsman could be dismissed lbw or caught and his partner run out the international cricket council is also considering an idea to modify the over period of fielding restrictions normally set for an innings start instead the batting side would choose three different slots of five overs when only two fielders would be permitted to cover the boundaries sunil gavaskar heads the icc committee which has recommended the proposal in bid to inject interest into the oneday game which the former india captain says has become predictable we ve looked at double play situation he explained in an interview with the melbourne age if batsman been given out lbw and the ball ricochets off to gully and the fielder picks it up and throws at the nonstriker end so you have two dismissals off one ball same if the ball gone up in the air the icc is discussing the proposals at meeting in melbourne

documents: bangladesh delighted at test win bangladeshi players and fans celebrated after the side historic first test victory over zimbabwe in chittagong thousands of fans armed with drums and flags ran into the streets in the capital dhaka within minutes of the end of the game halting traffic it the best day in my life won forget the day was member of bangladesh winning team don want to remember those hard days only want to think about the victory said captain habibul bashar bangladesh president iajuddin ahmed prime minister khaleda zia and opposition leader sheikh hasina have all congratulated the team the win by runs in chittagong was bangladesh first test win at their th attempt since being granted test status in bangladesh managed three draws in their previous matches two of them against zimbabwe and one against west indies bangladesh coach dav whatmore described the victory as wonderful feeling you can see the joy and the relief of lots of other people whatmore told bbc world service we ve taken our share of hammerings in the last year and half and putting this win in perspective there probably few more down the track but sense there a bit more selfbelief when they come to play tougher opposition whatmore led sri lanka to victory in the world cup and said this could not compare but he continued it was important for the whole country that the sport of cricket stand up and show that we re progressing there been lot of frustration for long time here in bangladesh that the team is not pushing the opposition enough the former australia test batsman played down the status of zimbabwe whose weakened side have just returned from sevenmonth suspension of their test status yes our opponents are ranked pretty much near us at the moment so right from the outset that would suggest we had chance of winning he added but to actually go out there and do it is another matter zimbabwe captain tatenda taibu who had made in the first innings but was dismissed for duck in the second was disappointed with the performance there was some bad cricket on our side and good cricket by the bangladeshis he said our top order batsmen didn come to the party and we dropped about four to five catches the second and final test of the series against zimbabwe begins on friday in dhaka

documents: wilson back in kiwi cricket squad former all blacks winger jeff wilson is back in the new zealand cricket squad after year absence wilson has been included by the kiwis to face world xi in oneday series in aid of the tsunami victims his last outing for the national team was in when he gave up cricket to concentrate on his rugby union career which came to an end in now that have this chance am looking forward to getting in there and making the most of it said wilson wilson had set his sights on returning to the new zealand side after resuming domestic first class cricket and team coach john bracewell has said the oneday matches are chance for the exall blacks winger to reestablish himself his match turning ability is undoubted and we just need to see if he can step up to this level again said nz coach bracewell the selectors have watched jeff and have no doubt that he is dynamic cricketer in march wilson played four one day international matches against australia he scored matchwinning not out in the final game of the series before concentrating on rugby union after making his debut for the all blacks later that year wilson takes the place of fast bowler ian butler who is suffering from bulging disc in his back the limitedovers series against world xi side being led by australian leg spinner shane warne begins in christchurch on january with the two other matches taking place in wellington on january and hamilton on january more than tickets were sold on the first day of them being made available given the very limited leadtime for these matches we obviously need the public to respond quickly and today has given us good start said new zealand cricket marketing manager peter dwan stephen fleming captain nathan astle chris cairns hamish marshall brendon mccullum kyle mills jacob oram mathew sinclair scott styris daryl tuffey daniel vettori jeff wilson

documents: rain holds up england fifth test centurion south africa england start delayed rain england lead the series with just this final test remaining so south africa desperately need to win the officials had hoped play could get under way at noon local time but further downpour led to an early lunch being taken by the players for england simon jones is expected to replace james anderson while the hosts play both andrew hall and andre nel with batsman boeta dippenaar dropped dale steyn had already been released from the squad for centurion and it means south africa go in with five seamers and one spin bowler on friday england captain michael vaughan had said it was important his team targeted victory and not simply draw he said you can set out over five days to draw game we have to try to win if you go out in mindset to draw you don have the right attitude we ll just set out in positive manner and try to put the south africans under lot of pressure england who have not won series in south africa for years will play on green pitch which has endured long spell of wet and humid weather the weather forecast for saturday onwards is fine and early starts on all four days from then could ensure there is plenty of time to achieve result middlesex opener andrew strauss with stunning aggregate of runs in the four tests played to date said south africa had every incentive to throw caution to the wind he said it been great series for me it been very satisfying but think we all realise that this last game is very important and we can afford to take our foot off the pedal now sometimes when you ve got lead it quite hard to keep yourself motivated we are pretty sure that the south africans will come back hard at us they have lot of motivation to do well against us this week south africa captain graeme smith said the colour of the pitch was probably misleading he said the pitch has played pretty well all year it might look bit juicy but will probably play pretty good he added that his team had the capability of bouncing back we came back in new zealand from down to level the series in wellington so we ve been in this situation before we ve just got to play some really good cricket for four to five days we ve had had lot of iffy performances so far with bit of luck here or there or playing some better cricket at certain times it could have easily been the other way round it been that sort of series ebb and flow and m sure it going to be that way again graeme smith capt herschelle gibbs jacques rudolph jacques kallis ab de villiers mark boucher wkt documents: holding slams twenty rubbish west indies great michael holding has branded twenty cricket rubbish as its international future is debated holding refused to watch last month twenty match between australia and pakistan in adelaide he told the voice it saddens me to hear people say that it is real contest between bat and ball how can simple slogging be good cricket it might have place in domestic cricket but should never be introduced as an international competition the international cricket council chief executives committee is to discuss the new format which has proved massive success at domestic level in melbourne on friday twenty cricket which features games lasting less that three hours was first launched in county cricket in it has since taken off domestically in south africa and australia are planning state competition next january new zealand will stage the first men international against australia next month and the aussies are to play england at the rose bowl in june however holding has told his television employers he does not want to commentate on the shortened game what is the point of telling youngsters to watch the game but not to copy the players techniques he continued there is nothing good about twenty cricket people who disagree don know what they are talking about

Label: cricket
documents: ecb defends england tour schedule the england and wales cricket board has defended its role in the scheduling of the tour to south africa criticism of the itinerary intensified after england defeat in cape town the last of three back to back tests ecb director of cricket operations john carr said we raised our eyebrows when he received the first draft from the south african board unfortunately south africa have got an incredibly condensed programme from last november to the end of may south africa toured india prior to england arrival and will follow their departure with series against zimbabwe and west indies we need to play seven test matches and oneday internationals during the course of the home programme to generate the revenue that helps fund all of english cricket we are expected to reciprocate similar amount of cricket over the winter months most years we manage that workload in more acceptable way in terms of when the cricket is played it just so happens that the logistics of international cricket at the moment and south africa programme in particular meant ther whole of our tour had to be condensed into very narrow period we weren in position to demand reduction in the number of test matches or oneday internationals explained carr he acknowledged the schedule was far from ideal for the players and said the subject of their workload was troubling the various boards around the world we have to hold our hands up along with the south african board and say that this winter it hasn been satisfactory situation carr added former england opening batsman geoffrey boycott described playing three tests back to back as madness and said carr and england coach duncan fletcher should never have agreed to it but graham thorpe at the oldest member of the england test squad told the bbc there was no point in complaining about the schedule three test matches in three and half weeks is tough schedule there no doubt about that he said in the first half of my career d go on tour and for four or five weeks and wouldn do anything bar playing couple of warmup games this is very different we re basically playing five test matches with no games in between that the way modern tours are now it exciting the games come thick and fast but there very little time to find your form it just case of having to get on with it we all knew how the tour was scheduled it one all after three test matches we ve taken beating in cape town but there no reason to be too down about it these things happen in sport

Label: cricket
documents: icc relaxes bowling regulations the international cricket council icc has agreed to relax its rules on bowling actions in bid to defuse one of the most divisive issues in cricket bowlers will be allowed to straighten their arms by up to degrees the amount visible to the naked eye but any bowler found to have an illegal action will be suspended immediately shortening the current review process this new process gives the game sensible way forward said icc chief executive malcolm speed on saturday this issue has afflicted the game for over years every time it comes up there are emotional reactions from people around the world based on fear and ignorance and ve no doubt we will see them all again this time the degree limit follows an extensive research programme conducted by biomechanics experts previously the levels were degrees for fast bowlers and five degrees for spinners the icc ordered review of its laws on throwing after several top international players including sri lankan muttiah muralitharan were reported for suspect actions muralitharan doosra legbreak delivery was found to involve flexion of degrees an expert panel comprising aravinda de silva angus fraser michael holding tony lewis tim may and david richardson found that most modern bowlers broke the rules in some way but it added that the laws to determine whether their action was legal or otherwise were murky and unworkable these recommendations have come from people who have played the game at the highest level and who have deep appreciation of the issues said icc cricket committee chairman sunil gavaskar

documents: new zealand to step up security new zealand cricket officials are to review security after australia players were hit by missiles during saturday opening oneday international the match was stopped several times after australian fielders complained they had been hit by plastic bottles new zealand cricket chief executive martin snedden labelled the missile throwing unacceptable it wasn the number of security guards it was the fact they needed to be more proactive he said australia captain ricky ponting complained immediately after his side run win someone going to get hurt you have to have more security guys around the players on the boundary he said however kiwi coach john bracewell accused australia of using the crowd as delaying tactic he claimed the missilethrowing was no different to the treatment his players got in australia former australia skipper steve waugh threatened to take his players off the field after similar crowd disturbances in new zealand five years ago think the tactical awareness as learned by steve waugh has been passed on bracewell said despite being hit by missile at one point aussie bowler glenn mcgrath was the star of the show returning figures of glenn was outstanding and we just did enough to win ponting said it a very hard place to win over here and we found that out tonight new zealand skipper stephen fleming praised hamish marshall whose almost rescued the match we were out of it came back really well hamish was outstanding but we just lost our way towards the end

documents: richardson ends just short new zealand batsman mark richardson bowed out of from all forms of cricket at the age of just short of firstclass runs richardson needed runs for auckland against canterbury to reach the milestone but finished on he made in his side first innings but did not bat again when auckland won by an innings and runs opener richardson only made his debut in but played in tests scoring runs at an average of but after impressing against england making century at lord he has struggled of late with just runs in two test defeats in australia he announced his retirement last week saying feel left something out on the park at lord and have lost the drive to play the richardson way m hanging my boots up for good since last year south african series ve started to struggle with the game emotionally and mentally richardson began his career as spin bowler but gained reputation as patient accumulator of runs scoring four test centuries his highest score of came against india in chandigarh in october new zealand recent tour of bangladesh saw richardson complete the set of visits to all testplaying nations however his batting approach and fielding ability did not suit the oneday game and he played in just four internationals nicknamed rigor mortis because of his slowness in the field richardson established tradition of racing the slowest member of the opposition teams in recent seasons have you seen the color of my hair and the big bald spot on the top of my head he quipped m but ve got the agility of about yearold the auckland native who has written regular column for bbc sport for the last three years intends to pursue career in the media new zealand captain stephen fleming says michael papps is favourite to take richardson place in the forthcoming series against sri lanka and australia

documents: usa cricket placed under threat world cricket bosses have threatened to pull out of plan to spread the game to the us because of poor organisation letter from the icc to the us cricket association was leaked to website we have never seen sporting organisation that combines such great potential and such poor administration as usaca said the letter we question whether the current administration of usaca can play any constructive role in taking the game forward in the united states project usa joint venture between the icc the usaca and the west indies cricket board was to have brought full oneday internationals involving leading teams to the country the revenue gained was to fund development looking to improve the standard of the us national team which was beaten heavily by new zealand and australia in september the letter signed by icc president ehsan mani and chief executive malcolm speed was addressed to usaca president gladstone dainty it went on we have been copied with numerous letters to and from you that indicate that usaca has plunged into further disarray further we have witnessed the abysmal performance of the usa cricket team at the icc champions trophy we have now been approached by other countries that would like to replace usa as the preferred partner of icc to deliver international cricket matches the usaca has until february to sign memorandum of understanding over project usa with the icc threatening to move it to another country otherwise among other secondtier nations the netherlands staged rainhit oneday series involving australia pakistan and india last august morocco and the united arab emirates are both nontestplaying nations that have successfully hosted international matches in the past the number of cricketers in the us has grown massively over the past decade to over and is now larger than anywhere outside the testplaying countries it is estimated there are over five million us immigrants from cricketplaying countries as potential audience for payperview television mani made us expansion one of his key aims when he came to office but plans to stage matches in the world cup there were abandoned because of logistical difficulties an icc spokesman told bbc sport the letter was not seeking to influence domestic governance it was simply expressing view

documents: icc to press on with dubai switch the international cricket council is expected to confirm its move from london to dubai with an announcement to be made later in january british sports minister richard caborn met icc president ehsan mani on monday in an attempt to persuade cricket governing body against making the move but the icc remains keen to move to the united arab emirates to take advantage of tax breaks not on offer in britain last december the uk treasury ruled out tax breaks for sports federations the icc is not impressed that it has taken so long for the british government to seek meeting with mani especially as it had first mooted move from lord in june last year mani told caborn that if circumstances had changed he would be prepared to consider asking his members to remain in london but whatever the department of culture media and sport can offer the biggest factor for the icc tax breaks remains something that only the treasury can rule on the icc recently voted with one abstention to move to dubai and now only the final details need to be arranged before everything is in place for the switch

games they will take place on and january and money raised will go to help the tsunami relief appeal australian shane warne will captain the world side with south african jonty rhodes acting as playercoach and the matches raise the prospect of warne bowling in tandem with sri lankan spinner muttiah muralitharan for the first time former england batsmen nick knight and graeme hick will be also part of the squad we hope to break even from the series or to run at manageable loss said new zealand cricket chief martin snedden it will be expensive but the benefits for the home cricket season and the black caps as well as those who benefit from our fundraising activities will make the series more than worthwhile the series will also be backed by the federation of international cricketers associations under whose name the world xi will play we believe we have responsibility to do whatever we can to support other members of the cricketing community in forming the inaugural fica world xi we are able to support icc member countries and the larger community at what is very difficult time the series will give us an opportunity to raise valuable funds through related charitable activities and ensure new zealand has international cricket at the height of its summer said fica chief executive tim may the venues for sri lanka tests in new zealand have yet to be decided and there is concern that weather could be factor in the series but snedden saidthe climatic conditions in early april are normally similar to those in march and we are confident test cricket documents: england fail to finish job again england have done their best throughout this series to suggest that they are vulnerable and on rainhit third day at centurion their batsmen did it again when michael vaughan horribly mispulled shaun pollock to square leg for fourball duck england had lost three tame wickets for two runs in three overs they seemed to be doing their best to keep the game open when they should have been doing their utmost to close it down the first to go was marcus trescothick who was run out thanks to misjudgement by andrew strauss trescothick at the nonstriker end responded to strauss call when he drove makhaya ntini to straight mid off but strauss suddenly changed his mind and as trescothick tried desperately to regain his ground nicky boje swooped onehanded and threw the stumps down direct robert key fell three overs later when he was caught behind down the leg side for single key glared at umpire bucknor when he raised his finger and dragged himself off the ground but replays suggested that he had indeed touched the ball four balls later vaughan was caught and england were reeling on andrew strauss then appeared completely to lose touch and frankly graham thorpe has only very occasionally been in form throughout the series the lefthanders scratched about barely laying bat on ball but somehow they survived despite some very close lbw appeals they managed to add between the interruptions until strauss uncharacteristically chased ball well wide of his off stump from andre nel and edged to boucher for moments later lightening drove the players from the ground time is ticking away now and with just two days to go it would take something remarkable for the south africans to win the match from here but england fallibility and their growing tendency to allow the opposition second chance is something that should concern their supporters everyone is anticipating close exciting ashes series in the summer but being completely honest england will have to improve enormously on their efforts on this tour even to come close to threatening the aussies

documents: strauss ton boosts england first test port elizabeth day two close south africa england strauss was not out after two days in port elizabeth as england closed inexorably on the hosts all out he put on for the first wicket with marcus trescothick and added more runs with mark butcher with no england batsman prepared to miss out earlier boeta dippenaar converted his overnight into century of his own the day began with south africa and hoping to reach at least with dippenaar and thami tsolekile batting together tsolekile initially looked uncomfortable against some shortpitched andrew flintoff bowling but steve harmison radar was awry and though runs came slowly there was little penetration from england seamers dippenaar eventually lifted the shackles by driving harmison through the covers for four an even better drive in the same area took him to before he put harmison high over gully for four more reaching only his third test century finally well into the second hour michael vaughan turned to his freshest bowler simon jones the welshman struck immediately as dippenaar edged into the safe hands of marcus trescothick at first slip tsolekile having hit one excellent boundary off ashley giles rashly attempted another soon after the loss of dippenaar it was big mistake though slogging across the line and against the spin he skewed the ball up into the covers for andrew flintoff to run round from slip to take the catch giles removed the last man dale steyn and from south africa had tumbled to all out strauss and trescothick had potentially awkward four overs before lunch to negotiate but having managed that they rarely looked troubled in the second session of the day strauss with series of cuts and pulls was the more attacking partner while trescothick was seeking to play himself into some form south africa were severely limited by having five rightarm seamers at their disposal and no spinner and when the score rattled along to shortly after tea they looked in deep trouble but debutant steyn who had bowled rash of noballs in nervous first spell suddenly found some extra pace and bit of reverse swing to bowl trescothick for the ball crashing into middle stump shaun pollock also got the ball to reverse in the air as the runs dried up with mark butcher trying to find his feet and strauss worrying about possible century but once strauss drove ntini immaculately down the ground for four to reach three figures butcher cashed in with two crisp coverdrives of his own for boundaries off andrew hall it was weary south african fielding side who marched off the park at stumps smith captain ab de villiers rudolph kallis dippenaar de bruyn hall pollock tsolekile wk ntini steyn vaughan captain trescothick strauss butcher thorpe flintoff jones wk giles jones hoggard harmison

documents: windies women in optimistic mood west indies are hopeful of making an impression at the women world cup in south africa despite financial problems which are overshadowing their buildup our major strength is our bowling which tends to be very very tight said coach ann brownejohn the batting is sound and the team spirit and togetherness the girls have been developing all go together to make them into very strong unit they will play holders new zealand in their first game on march all eight teams will face each other under league format with the top four then progressing to the semifinals bad weather forced the west indies indoors at last weekend training camp but they have another lasting two weeks which will begin on february they last played international cricket in india and pakistan last year winning the latter series after being outplayed in all five games in india these matches exposed us to what women cricket is all about and how we should go about playing the game think with that experience behind us we should do very well captain stephanie power commented

documents: pakistan to host next asia cup pakistan are to host their first asia cup oneday tournament next march according to pakistan cricket board chairman shaharyar khan khan told the reuters agency decision had been made at monday meeting of the asian cricket council in dubai he said india sri lanka and bangladesh have all confirmed their participation and that qualifiers would also feature six teams including hong kong played in the eighth asia cup in sri lanka last year the hosts triumphing pakistan has not hosted any of the previous tournaments dating back to because of poor diplomatic relations with neighbours india

three balls in the second over of the pakistan reply and the tourists were in disarray umar played fluently hitting just four boundaries but could not find partner as five batsmen fell in single figures he and inzamamulhaq added for the fifth wicket but the pakistan captain was run out for although younis khan and iftikhar anjum kept the pace brisk they were well off the required pace in an unbeaten partnership of both sides were penalised six runs for slow overrates twenty cricket which involves batsmen sitting on the boundary edge waiting to go in and bowlers given reduced time to get through their overs was first launched in county cricket in it has since taken off domestically in south africa and in women cricket where the first international involved england and new zealand last year new zealand and sri lanka had planned to play the first twenty international but the tour was cut short because of the tsunami disaster australia senior team will get their first taste of the shortened format in june when they tour england cricket australia chief executive james sutherland said twenty cricket between state sides could be possibility for next year it happening in other parts of the world and has been embraced at domestic cricket level he said the signals we re getting in these last two days is that it something the fans are interested in seeing more of and we need to look at the way in which we can introduce it on perhaps more formal basis next season inzamam predicted twenty could become the most popular form of the sport worldwide think after four or five documents: england on brink of defeat tour match potchefstroom day three of three rain england south africa after martin van jaarsveld was removed for duck in the first over andrew puttick made with seven fours but he and justin ontong who hit four fours in fell in consecutive overs after break for lightning and with needed to win heavy rain arrived england were dismissed for adding michael vaughan ninth out after two more fours and six en route to with the home side moving serenely at faint hopes of an escape for england arrived in the form of violent clap of thunder which took the players off the field lightning struck field next to the ground but there was no rain and play resumed within minutes it did have beneficial effect for the tourists as two wickets fell within six balls puttick was caught behind and ontong hooked steve harmison to the fineleg boundary where ashley giles took an impressive running catch to his left vaughan began the day on not out his team ahead with three wickets intact he signalled his intentions in the very first over with four through midon and six over longon from the spin of ontong hopes of long partnership with county colleague matthew hoggard were ended in the fourth over of the morning when the seamer was caught at second slip having failed to add to his overnight three having pulled charl willoughby through midwicket for four and clipped him away to reach three figures vaughan chased wide one from the leftarmer end edged to keeper mark boucher he spent minutes at the crease and faced balls me trescothick mp vaughan capt aj strauss ma butcher gp thorpe flintoff go jones wkt af giles sp jones sj harmison mj hoggard ashwell prince capt justin ontong mark boucher wkt jp duminy charl langeveldt ethy mbhalati albie morkel andrew puttick alfonso thomas martin van jaarsveld charl willoughby

documents: india clear for chittagong games indian cricket officials have given clearance for the national team to play in chittagong during their tour to bangladesh which began on wednesday the team received alleged death threats from radical muslim group but the foreign ministry were satisfied with security arrangements in dhaka where the first test begins on friday and the team have now given the green light for the games scheduled for chittagong which will stage the second test and first oneday international we have now received assessment of the indian security team that went to chittagong they made full assessment of the security arrangements in consultation with the bangladesh authorities on the basis of security team report the government is advising bcci to go ahead with the matches in chittagong said foreign ministry spokesman navtej sarna the inspection covered the venue hotel and other areas where the indian cricket team will be present specific recommendations for tightening security arrangements and these have been accepted by the bangladesh authorities letter apparently from previously unknown islamic group harkatuljihad arrived at the indian embassy last thursday it threatened to kill the players in revenge for the riots in gujarat in india three years ago which left many muslims dead however the bangladesh high commission said the threats were hoax explosions and other attacks are not uncommon in bangladesh more than people were killed when grenades were thrown at an opposition rally in august there have also been blasts at cinemas few arrests have been made but islamic extremists are widely blamed indian cricketers have visited bangladesh several times most recently in for triangular tournament that also involved south africa

documents: south africa far too strong again second oneday international durban south africa beat zimbabwe by runs south africa lead threematch series smith set up the best total at durban in oneday internationals he was given fine support by herschelle gibbs they added before justin kemp hit not out off just balls zimbabwe finished on to lose by runs with barney rogers the topscorer south africa lead the series with just one to play rogers put on for the first wicket with stuart matsikenyeri but their partnership soaked up overs matsikenyeri labouring for minutes over his innings of before offering catch off the bowling of albie morkel the same bowler struck soon afterwards as rogers clipped fullish delivery to wide midon nicky boje and adam bacher each took brace of wickets as the middle order simply played for pride and it was telling that bacher whose military medium pace was not even experimented with against england finished with off full allotment of overs zimbabwe had won the toss at the start of the day and did well with the ball early on reducing the south africans to in the th over but smith and gibbs who so often form powerful partnership in both tests and oneday internationals were not backwards in coming forward launching barrage of boundaries off the spinners zimbabwe were hampered when strike bowler tinashe panyangara left the field in his fourth over with back strain the spinners had to do plenty of work as result and one of them prosper utseya went for in six overs gibbs took particular liking to him before eventually falling to rogers for off balls seam bowler christopher mpofu took in his nine overs he was impressive in the main but had to bowl the final over of the innings which disappeared for as justin kemp equalled the fastest halfcentury by south african he hit two fours and five towering sixes in brutal display of hitting afterwards kemp said he knew nothing about the record had no idea he admitted was just thinking about smashing every ball for six graeme smith captain adam bacher jacques rudolph herschelle gibbs ashwell prince justin kemp mark boucher albie morkel nicky boje andrew hall charl langeveldt stuart matsikenyeri documents: jayasuriya set to join somerset somerset are expected to announce later on thursday that sri lankan batsman sanath jayasuriya will join the county for the start of the season chief executive peter anderson told bbc sport that the club would release statement on the matter at gmt jayasuriya will probably fill the place of graeme smith on temporary basis as the south african is due to arrive in late may to captain the team jayasuriya had rejected an offer to play for the scottish saltires jayasuriya has played in tests averaging with the bat and taking wickets with his leftarm spin he has also played in more oneday internationals than all but three players in world cricket with appearances but the attackminded lefthander has never played county cricket before it is shaping up to be golden summer for sri lankans in english domestic cricket with upul chandana gloucestershire chaminda vaas worcestershire and muttiah muralitharan lancashire all contracted kumar sangakkara and mahela jayawardene are also reported to be looking for opportunities

Label: cricket
documents: batsman van jaarsveld joins kent south african batsman martin van jaarsveld has ended his international career to sign contract with kent the yearold will move to england under the kolpak ruling meaning he is not classed as an overseas player kent chief executive paul millman refused to disclose the length of the deal but told bbc sport that he would be joining for at least two years we ve been talking to him for some time but he was under contract so we had to stay silent he continued now he has released himself from that we are very happy that he joining us and has committed to playing for kent van jaarsveld played the last of his nine tests for south africa against england in december but has since fallen down the pecking order you need continuity in the dressing room we had five overseas players last year and he freed himself up to be available for us for the whole season millman added when you see that there are tours going on around the world it very difficult to pinpoint talent for long period of time and this is the solution kent chairman of cricket graham johnson added while at present we do not plan to engage second overseas player the option remains available to us should we wish to do so on shortterm basis van jaarsveld hit runs in seven county championship matches with northamptonshire last year and said the opportunity to return to county cricket was too good to turn down having understood that my future international prospects might be limited needed to weigh up my options and make decision that was in the best interests of my longterm future he explained van jaarsveld domestic side in south africa the centurionbased titans said the batsman may play for them in future however he would have to be classed as an overseas player in the republic

documents: streak ends zim dispute former captain heath streak has signed contract to play for zimbabwe after ending his month dispute with the country cricketing authorities streak was sacked last april after criticising zimbabwe cricket selection policies just need to finalise some aspects of my contract with warwickshire so that it ties in with my international commitments the yearold said otherwise am ready to play for zimbabwe when selected streak who could now join up with the zimbabwe squad in south africa added am putting my weight fully behind captain tatenda taibu and the rest of the lads warwickshire meanwhile expect streak to play for them this summer as planned club spokesman keith cook told bbc sport we had an email from heath overnight via his agent in which he states that he wants to coordinate his international commitments with warwickshire and incorporate our views into his thinking in theory there would be no major conflict of interests this summer as zimbabwe tour to south africa ends in midmarch and they are not in action again until september when they play host to new zealand but streak situation will be discussed by the warwickshire committee at meeting on monday following streak sacking by zimbabwe players resigned in protest but gavin ewing barney rogers and andy blignaut have also returned to the fold and more could follow suit zc say they are in negotiations with the remaining rebels but it is believed that grant flower essex and ray price worcestershire are unlikely to sign deals after committing themselves to playing county cricket in england next season

documents: hodge earns aussie test call australia have named prolific batsman brad hodge in their man squad for the test series in new zealand the yearold victorian went on the tour to india last year but has yet to play test despite consistent performances in domestic cricket veteran batsman darren lehmann needs shoulder surgery and misses out as does allrounder shane watson who has just recovered from torn side muscle the first of three tests will be in christchurch from march hodge only played one warmup match on the tour of india but heavy scoring in recent weeks for victoria has earned him the nod ahead of mike hussey and andrew symonds chairman of selectors trevor hohns said he has presented an irresistible case to be part of this tour and if he gets the opportunity we feel confident that he can do good job for australia we said during the indian series when he missed out on spot in the test xi that he was still in line for national selection his domestic form has ensured that this is the case hohns says the small size of the squad will not pose problems for the tourists most of whom are already in new zealand where they have won the first four oneday internationals opening batsman justin langer and legspinner shane warne will join up with them on monday march we feel that this is balanced squad and don believe we have to extend the size of the touring party beyond players hohns added we have plenty of options with both bat and ball and given the close proximity of the two countries we always have the option of flying players in as the series progresses pace bowler brett lee is hoping to play his first test since january last year after impressing in the oneday game but hohns hinted he faces tough task to displace glenn mcgrath jason gillespie or michael kasprowicz who took combined total of test wickets in everyone been singing their praises during that period and you only have to look at their results there not too many sides who ve scored many runs against that threepronged attack ricky ponting capt adam gilchrist michael clarke jason gillespie matthew hayden brad hodge michael kasprowicz simon katich justin langer brett lee damien martyn glenn mcgrath shane warne

documents: weather worry for pakistan pakistan have voiced concern about the choice of dharamshala to stage their only warmup game in india tuesday practice session had to be cancelled because of rain and the forecast is gloomy until the weekend they are also worried about travel schedule which could disrupt practice in mohali venue for the first test if we have to go back the same way we came in two flights we may not be able to practice on sunday said team manager salim altaf we will get only one day nets in mohali pakistan are due to begin threeday game against an indian board president xi at altitude at dharamshala on thursday but the players could only watch the skies from their hotel after an hourlong drive from kangra airport where they had arrived in two planes because of its short runway we are helpless before nature said anurag thakur president of the local himachal pradesh cricket association everybody is keeping their fingers crossed he added we are here to play and do not want to go into the test series short of match practice wish the rain would go away said altaf meanwhile chief selector wasim bari is hopeful that shoaib akhtar absence can inspire mohammad sami to new level on the tour akhtar will miss the test series because of hamstring trouble but is hoping to return for the onedayers he ll be missed and every player needs extra to overcome his loss but one hopes with the responsibilty the best in sami will come out bari said they can spring surprise in india think we have talented side bari feels the team is capable of responding favourably to the disappointment of their tour to australia which saw them heavily beaten in all threeday tests and also lose the final of the triangular oneday series obviously they made some mistakes on their last tour of australia but they must capitalise on the lessons they learnt bari observed good results will pave the way for the young team to get on the right path and attain more maturity the tour is pakistan first to india since and they are looking to atone for last year home defeat by their archrivals the dalai lama who has lived in exile in dharamshala since fleeing china in will not inaugurate thursday match as originally planned there were reports that the pakistan cricket board were concerned about his presence because of their country good relations with china the decision has been taken by the dalai lama as he didn want to cause inconvenience to anyone said his spokesman tenzin takla

documents: aussie mcgrath to take match off third oneday international auckland new zealand australia match begins gmt opener matthew hayden will also sit out the match because of shoulder injury suffered in the second game on tuesday mcgrath place goes to michael kasprowicz while simon katich replaces hayden and will open the batting in preference to michael clarke new zealand trail and need to win in auckland to keep the fivematch series alive the black caps dropped batsman mathew sinclair after the opening two defeats calling in opener michael papps and allrounder andre adams but adams has been ruled out due to illness adding to the home side woes after scott styris injured his knee batsman james marshall will make his international debut after acting as th man in the last game marshall is the identical twin of hamish marshall new zealand best batsman in the first match news that several batsmen had spent time with the team psychologist on wednesday added to the air of desperation in the new zealand camp but captain stephen fleming played that down and emphasised pride is at stake with three games left in the series we re pretty determined we know the importance of the match to keep the series alive he said but more importantly we want to play up to the standard we have over the last months australia have now won of their last oneday matches against new zealand and captain ricky ponting was in no mood to loosen his side grip on the series against their local rivals sure we re in great position and we ve played some pretty good cricket but we still think we can keep improving he said all we can do is keep trying to win and keep trying to improve and if that means we get psychological hold over new zealand then well and good fleming capt astle marshall mcmillan cairns mccullum wkt vettori wilson mills tuffey papps marshall ponting captain gilchrist katich martyn clarke hussey symonds hogg lee gillespie kasprowicz

documents: bashar delighted after series win bangladesh skipper habibul bashar was thrilled after the win in the decider against zimbabwe gave his country their firstever oneday series triumph yes our morale was down after losing the first two matches he said after the eightwicket victory in dhaka but we knew we could come back and win the series we worked hard and tried to rectify our mistakes and am happy to have won the match chasing target which was not easy taibu counterpart tatenda taibu was left to reflect on what might have been after losing the early initiative in the fivematch series it was so near and yet so far for us said the zimbabwe captain think we did not play spin well enough and lost wickets at crucial stages they played well but think our boys did good job we worked hard and fought it out bangladesh have won only nine of their matches since making their oneday debut in and clinched their maiden test series against zimbabwe earlier in january

documents: tendulkar eyes test return star batsman sachin tendulkar is hopeful he will be fit for india home series against pakistan next month the yearold is poised to make his return from longterm elbow injury on tuesday in domestic fourday match m here to prepare myself in particular way said tendulkar who has not played competitively since the bangladesh tour in december have to see how go in the match nobody knows what going to happen but right now feel fully fit tendulkar will captain west zone against south zone in the duleep trophy in hyderabad india paceman irfan pathan who missed several domestic games this month due to side strain is also set to make his comeback in the same game tendulkar injury problems has been attributed mainly to wear and tear caused by nonstop cricket since he emerged on the international scene in as yearold pakistan arrive in delhi on february for their first tour to india in six years which includes three tests and six oneday games

documents: russell to instruct keeper jones former england and gloucestershire wicketkeeper jack russell has been called in to give coaching to current national team gloveman geraint jones jones did not have the best of tours in south africa dropping catches and conceding too many byes now england coach duncan fletcher has sought out the test veteran russell told the daily express duncan and captain michael vaughan have asked me to build relationship with geraint and give him whatever help he needs the pair have already worked closely but russell will be heavily involved as the countdown to the ashes begins he said geraint has got the ability to play tests for england he has the right attitude people have to remember he is still quite raw there are some things we need to work out but it just case of smoothing out few rough edges in terms of winning the ashes he has got an important role to play he can do some real damage and ve no doubt he has the stomach for fight meanwhile steve harmison has reflected on his even more disappointing tour of south africa harmison told the news of the world it was high intensity high pressure cricket for the whole tour and that mentally and physically draining it certainly wasn the best environment in which to hit bad patch

documents: pakistan on revenge mission pakistan cricketers depart for delhi on monday with captain inzamamulhaq beseeching his side to make up for the defeat to india on home soil india outplayed pakistan months ago beating them in the tests and in the oneday internationals inzamam said ahead of pakistan first full tour of india for six years we want to make amends for last year the australian tour was big learning experience and think we are in position to reap benefits in india series between india and pakistan are always eagerly awaited largely because politics often restrict the amount of cricket the two teams can play against each other this particular engagement which will include three tests and six onedayers was twice threatened the schedule has already been put back four days over dispute which centred on pakistan refusal to play the second test in ahmedabad the first test in mohali will now get under way on march then following protracted row over television rights the madras high court issued interim orders to ensure the matches would be broadcast live by stateowned channel doordarshan after the series between the two sides pakistan sacked their coach javed miandad inzamam believes his replacement bob woolmer has improved the side even if string of positive results have not yet come he said lot has changed since that series woolmer has helped change the attitude of the boys which is more positive and professional and think they can take the pressure of playing in india pakistan will be without strike bowler shoaib akhtar hamstring leaving recalled offspinner arshad khan and legspinner danish kaneria with much work to do inzamam said shoaib absence will be felt but our strength is playing as unit have big role to play in india they are the ones on whom we will be depending lot in the test matches we are expecting slow turning tracks and we have been practicing for such conditions pakistan first match is threeday warmup against the indian board president xi in dharamsala from march salman butt yasir hameed taufeeq umar younis khan inzamamulhaq captain yousuf youhana asim kamal kamran akmal wkt abdul razzaq shoaib malik shahid afridi arshad documents: tuffey pays price for profligacy new zealand have dropped seam bowler daryl tuffey following his woeful display in the third oneday international against australia tuffey sent down four noballs and four wides in ball opening over and went for runs off two overs before he was removed from the attack new zealand lost by runs as australia wrapped up the series with two matches remaining lance hamilton replaces tuffey for the fourth odi in wellington on tuesday kiwi captain stephen fleming said he was disappointed with tuffey performance at eden park there was lot of faith put in him for this game he told the sunday startimes there were question marks over his form from the first two games and that performance was certainly not up to international standard you have got to be pretty disappointed when he bowled so well for us in the past and then he puts in performance like that michael papps who was twice hit on the head by brett lee bouncers on saturday will also be missing although scan revealed he had avoided serious injury otago batsman craig cumming has been called up as his replacement andre adams is not ready to return to the side as he continues to struggle with the viral infection that has plagued him for most of the season stephen fleming captain nathan astle craig cumming hamish marshall james marshall craig mcmillan chris cairns brendon mccullum daniel vettori jeff wilson kyle mills lance hamilton

documents: tudor given fresh start by essex former england paceman alex tudor has joined essex on oneyear contract the yearold who test caps was released by surrey at the end of last season after years at the oval he only played one championship game in because of side injury and has agreed performance related terms with essex after treatment by specialist am determined to repay essex for the faith they have shown in me this is new start for me and am just itching to get out on the field he said ronnie irani phoned me up after he heard d been released by surrey and said he wanted to get me fit even if didn sign he just wanted to get me back on the cricket field ve had spinal problem and essex put me in touch with some people in germany and owe them lot he added tudor is also useful performer with the bat and became an overnight hero in when his innings of not out against new zealand saw england to test victory at edgbaston he last played for england on the ashes tour when ironically he joined the squad as replacement for new essex teammate darren gough irani described tudor as worldclass signing he told the club website he is role model professional with firstclass attitude who will be great asset to the team there has obviously been question mark over alex fitness record of late but he has gone to extreme measures in order to get himself back on track if all goes well then hopefully we will be talking about alex tudor in the future as an essex and england player the signing was also welcomed by coach graham gooch who was england manager on tudor first tour to australia in had nothing other than praise for the way he conducted himself both on the field where he performed well in all three disciplines and in the dressing room said gooch alex is an international quality player and good team man who will be well motivated to prove his doubters wrong

documents: england slump to defeat fourth oneday international cape town south africa overs beat england all out overs by runs the home side tallied massive with gibbs making jacques kallis and justin kemp from balls in reply england were three wickets down inside eight overs and bowled out for in overs kevin pietersen smashed from balls but was caught in the deep trying to up the tempo in all sixes were hit at sunbaked newlands kemp accounting for four of them with three each for gibbs and pietersen gibbs and kallis who both play for home side western province set new mark for the third wicket at this ground and beat their own record set last week for the third wicket against england with stand of they set an even pace notching halfcenturies from successive deliveries but still looked under par when kallis was run out by brilliant direct throw from paul collingwood at point however kemp helped add in the last overs of the south african innings building brutally on that platform kemp best six came off darren gough drive into the pavilion at long on and gough was actually hanging on to one of gibbs maximums the momentum carrying him over the boundary rope england looked like keeping pace only as far as the sixth over of their reply when geraint jones edged ntini behind with on the board captain michael vaughan who returned from illness and replaced vikram solanki in the lineup followed for duck in the next over edging shaun pollock to slip and marcus trescothick went four balls later playing around an ntini yorker which took out his middle stump andrew strauss who made and paul collingwood with both settled but failed to move on and pietersen was left to stage his own firework display falling to his third successive slogsweep off spinner nicky boje after the first two had flown over the squareleg boundary pietersen sporting new hairstyle with diagonal streak of bleached blond took his series figures to runs at an average of ntini had ashley giles caught at cover for to finish with ignoring the fact that the team batting first has won of the last oneday internationals at the cape town ground vaughan had opted to put the home side in on winning the toss he was forced into making changes early though as steve harmison struggled in his first match back from calf injury the pace bowler who replaced matthew hoggard in the lineup conceded runs off his first three overs including four wides although darren gough dismissed ab de villiers lbw he was also wayward early and it took the arrival of kabir ali as the firstchange bowler to apply the brakes ali the hero of wednesday tie in bloemfontein dismissed graeme smith the hero of friday victory lbw with straight delivery that may have been little too high and with collingwood in support his first sixover spell brought figures of ali early figures were decimated though in the closing stages as gibbs and kemp blazed to put the match out of reach the teams meet again in east london on wednesday for the fifth instalment of the sevenmatch series c smith capt b de villiers h kallis h gibbs g prince m kemp v boucher wkt m pollock boje ntini nel mp vaughan capt e trescothick o jones j strauss p pietersen r bell d collingwood f giles kabir ali gough harmison

documents: kaif absence wrong azharuddin india were wrong to leave mohammad kaif out of their squad for the first test against pakistan according to former captain mohammad azharuddin azharuddin serving life ban for matchfixing feels the middleorder batsman deserves another chance kaif batted very well against australia on tough wicket azharuddin told bbc sport he got lot of talent and am sure he cannot be held back his omission is not good for his confidence kaif scored two fifties in last year home series loss to the aussies while yuvraj singh failed badly against the same opponents yet was given squad berth for the mohali test starting on march azharuddin reckons vangipurappu laxman should bat at first drop despite struggling for form laxman has always played well when he has gone as number three he said lower down the order lot of pressure is on him and if were the captain would have played him at number three as well as spinners harbhajan singh and anil kumble india have four pacemen to choose from after naming ashish nehra lakshmipathy balaji irfan pathan and zaheer khan in the man squad all the four pace bowlers deserve to get into the team azharuddin added pakistan minus injured paceman shoaib akhtar are due to arrive in india on monday ahead of their first warmup match against the indian board president xi starting on thursday shoaib akhtar absence in the pakistani side is not going to make much of difference azharuddin opined he may get wicket or two but he has to be more consistent also the indian batting is very strong now azharuddin maintains his innocence despite his central involvement in the matchfixing scandal of which saw pakistani salim malik and the late hansie cronje of south africa also receive life bans in tests for india from to azharuddin scored runs at an average of with centuries

ended his disagreement with zimbabwe cricket said m looking forward to getting back obviously there an element of concern at not having played at this level for while but it not like haven been playing cricket had good season at warwickshire and have been playing club cricket on sunday captain tatenda taibu said streak and andy blignaut would be considered for the test series in south africa starting on march but now it looks as though in the case of streak comeback could be even more immediate and zimbabwe team manager babu memen said it very likely that he will play on wednesday and he will stay on for the test series former captain streak was sacked in april after criticising zimbabwe cricket selection policies following streak dismissal white players resigned in protest but gavin ewing and barney rogers have already returned to the fold and blignaut and streak are poised to do likewise when streak announced he had put aside his differences with zc on friday the board managing director ozias bvute announced heath is immediately available for selection now streak says he will be happy to play under the new regime with taibu as captain he said ve always played the best can gripper neil ferreira and charles coventry have decided to make themselves available for selection for the team fivematch oneday home series for zimbabwe second string against bangladesh starts on documents: india confident of deal the president of the indian board has insisted the home series against pakistan will go ahead despite an ongoing legal wrangle over tv rights we are confident something will be worked out as soon as we hear from the courts we will work on war footing said ranbir singh mahendra zee tv who are challenging the board decision to scrap xcxam right deal have offered compromise they have offered to screen the series as oneoff in letter to the board they wrote ztl would do this entirely at its risks and costs and without any equity in its favour this shall also be without prejudice to the respective contentions of the parties before the madras court zee say they would only require to be paid mutually agreed production costs the pakistan cricket board meanwhile has expressed concern about earlier news reports that the series could be postponed again until the court case is resolved such move would be highly disappointing as fans in both countries are eagerly awaiting the series read pcb statement it would also lead to severe loss of revenue for both boards and dislocation in logistics for postponed tour moreover further postponement of the tour would be difficult because pakistan will be touring the west indies in early may the statement continued the pakistan squad is due to arrive in india on monday to play three tests and six oneday internationals the tour has already been postponed once while the two boards revised the itinerary after pakistan refused to play test in ahmedabad because of security concerns losing the series would be massive blow to the prestige of mahendra who replaced jagmohan dalmiya as bcci president last september but he told the agence france presse the tour will go ahead as scheduled yes there has been delay on tv rights but that is because the matter is in court zee was awarded fouryear contract last year but the board tried to reopen the bidding process after espnstar sports and rupert murdoch news corporation challenged the original decision espn and indian state broadcaster doordarshan are also talking to the board in an attempt to ensure the series goes ahead

rain and the forecast is gloomy until the weekend they are also worried about travel schedule which could disrupt practice in mohali venue for the first test if we have to go back the same way we came in two flights we may not be able to practice on sunday said team manager salim altaf we will get only one day nets in mohali pakistan are due to begin threeday game against an indian board president xi at altitude at dharamshala on thursday but the players could only watch the skies from their hotel after an hourlong drive from kangra airport where they had arrived in two planes because of its short runway we are helpless before nature said anurag thakur president of the local himachal pradesh cricket association everybody is keeping their fingers crossed he added we are here to play and do not want to go into the test series short of match practice wish the rain would go away said altaf meanwhile chief selector wasim bari is hopeful that shoaib akhtar absence can inspire mohammad sami to new level on the tour akhtar will miss the test series because of hamstring trouble but is hoping to return for the onedayers he ll be missed and every player needs extra to overcome his loss but one hopes with the responsibilty the best in sami will come out bari said they can spring surprise in india think we have talented side bari feels the team is capable of responding favourably to the disappointment of their tour to australia which saw them heavily beaten in all threeday tests and also lose the final of the triangular oneday series obviously they made some mistakes on their last tour of australia but they must capitalise on the lessons they learnt bari observed good results will pave the way for the young team to get on the right path and attain more maturity the tour is pakistan first to india since and they are looking to atone for last year home defeat by their archrivals the dalai lama who has lived in exile in dharamshala since fleeing china in will not inaugurate thursday match as originally planned there were reports that the pakistan cricket board were concerned about his presence because of their country good relations with china the decision has been taken by the dalai lama as he didn want to cause inconvenience to anyone said his spokesman tenzin takla

documents: west indies opener rae mourned former west indies test batsman allan rae has died in kingston jamaica at the age of after long illness rae scored runs in tests as an opener between averaging and making four centuries he was part of the first windies team to defeat england in test series in before quitting the firstclass game to focus on his legal career rae then went on to become president of the west indies cricket board position he held from in his book history of west indies cricket former jamaican prime minister michael manley said rae brought to the presidency some of the most important characteristics of the finest administrative leaders deep sense of tradition with mind always open to change he praised rae behind the scenes work with sir don bradman to bring the west indies and australia players involved in kerry packer world series back into the cricket establishment during his time as president number of west indies players were given life bans for going on unauthorised tours to south africa rae playing career began in and he soon earned place in the west indies team marking his first series with centuries against india in bombay now mumbai and madras chennai part of strong opening partnership with jeff stollmeyer he is best remembered for his part in the tour to england when he made at lord and at the oval as west indies won the series he only played six tests thereafter his last against india at port of spain in february allan meant so much to our cricket not only as player but also as hardworking administrator said bryan breese chief executive of the jamaica cricket association he even neglected his legal practice at times because of his dedication to cricket in jamaica

documents: jayasuriya set to join somerset somerset are expected to announce later on thursday that sri lankan batsman sanath jayasuriya will join the county for the start of the season chief executive peter anderson told bbc sport that the club would release statement on the matter at gmt jayasuriya will probably fill the place of graeme smith on temporary basis as the south african is due to arrive in late may to captain the team jayasuriya had rejected an offer to play for the scottish saltires jayasuriya has played in tests averaging with the bat and taking wickets with his leftarm spin he has also played in more oneday internationals than all but three players in world cricket with appearances but the attackminded lefthander has never played county cricket before it is shaping up to be golden summer for sri lankans in english domestic cricket with upul chandana gloucestershire chaminda vaas worcestershire and muttiah muralitharan lancashire all contracted kumar sangakkara and mahela jayawardene are also reported to be looking for opportunities

documents: pakistan accept venues compromise the doubts surrounding pakistan tour of india have receded after the two boards agreed to move the second test from ahmedabad to calcutta in return for switching the test pakistan have agreed to play an extra oneday international in ahmedabad the tour may get delayed by three to four days said pakistan cricket board chairman shaharyar khan ahmedabad was the scene of religious riots in and pakistan cricketers had been wary of playing there but compromise solution was reached on friday day after the tour schedule had been due to be confirmed sixth oneday international will be played in ahmedabad to appease the gujarat cricket association the pakistan cricket board initially suggested mumbai as an alternative for the ahmedabad test but it was agreed it would be played in calcutta kolkata khan met india external affairs minister natwar singh in islamabad on thursday and also held telephone talks with jagmohan dalmiya patron of the board of control for cricket in india we hope final itinerary will be announced by the bcci later on friday said khan we are in constant touch with them so we can agree on the dates for the tour to start because they have lot of work to do am happy that the matter is resolved and the tour will get on smoothly the first and third tests will take place at mohali and bangalore while cochin vishakapatnam delhi jamshedpur and kanpur will stage the other five oneday internationals the indian government has confirmed that visas will be granted to pakistan supporters who wish to attend the mohali test the sevenweek tour will be pakistan first to india in six years and their squad is due to be announced on saturday they were due to arrive in delhi on or february and begin threeday warmup match on the th however tv rights have yet to be awarded with counterpetition from zee due to be heard at the madras high court on thursday the bcci backed out of fouryear deal with zee last september after espnstar sports challenged it in court salim altaf the pcb director of cricket operations has been appointed team manager for the tour he replaces former test batsman haroon rashid it another big responsibility and considering the importance of the tour will try to do my best altaf said
