documents: bracewell worried by lee new zealand coach john bracewell is furious that australia paceman brett lee has bowled four beamers at his batsmen in the current oneday series brendon mccullum was struck on the arm by waisthigh full toss in auckland on sunday match australia won bracewell said he been apologetic every time he done it he was apologetic when he did it to chris harris and paul wiseman and he apologised twice to brendon that a lot of apologies bracewell was also of the view that lee had bowled beamer at pakistan abdul razzaq during the vb series on sunday furious mccullum confronted lee midpitch after being struck on the arm and while the incident was later resolved bracewell was not happy lee who took off seven overs on saturday and also sent michael papps to hospital with bouncer was contrite afterwards he said the heavy dew caused his feet to shift on delivery stride and he lost control against mccullum unfortunately the ball came out and it hit him thank god it didn hurt him said lee know when was beamed accidently by razzaq your first impression is to go crazy lost it there for seconds and went up and apologised and said would never mean to do that australia captain ricky ponting refuses to admit there is animosity between the sides despite bracewell disquiet teams have got on very well ponting said we ve been in each other rooms after every game relations have been very good the only thing was the fulltoss that brett bowled otherwise everything been great it been good series played in great spirit in the laws of the game bowler is removed from the attack by the umpires for bowling two beamers in match whether accidental or not any delivery that passes the batsman at or above waistheight without bouncing is deemed noball

documents: batting prospects excite vaughan england skipper michael vaughan is excited over potential middleorder allegiance between andrew flintoff and kevin pietersen this summer provided flintoff is fully recovered from an ankle operation he and pietersen may pose big threat to australia in the ashes test series if those two get going there will be need for helmets in the crowd said vaughan of the bighitting duo they re destructive and can take the game to the opposition amazingly flintoff is yet to play in test against australia but is progressing well in his recovery from the operation on his left ankle having had the plaster cast surrounding the joint removed the last few ashes encounters have seen england decimated by injury but vaughan is hoping not to have this burden during the summer pietersen three oneday centuries in south africa recently have ushered him to the front of the queue for batting place but he would have to dislodge rob key and mark butcher from the waiting list and ian bell has also staked claim for place when you play australia you need character and bit of arrogance about you and kevin has those attributes vaughan continued but there is not only kevin pietersen available we have options in the batting department and players are going to be disappointed we would rather disappoint few players than not have enough england will be buoyed up by the test series victory in south africa but vaughan is pragmatic enough to know that australia are the benchmark by how his side will be judged vaughan added it is challenge am really looking forward to because when you face the biggest challenges you have to relish it and am sure the team will be thinking the same way

documents: streak happy with comeback heath streak was pleased with his performance on his zimbabwe comeback despite the defeat to south africa streak made bu the home side won the third and final oneday international by five wickets at port elizabeth he said was nervous especially because of the situation when came in the important thing was to chip in had to stay until the end and play each ball on merit the important thing was to keep the ball on the ground and not play too many special shots thanks in the main to streak zimbabwe recovered from to post in their overs and then reduced the home side to but justin kemp who was lucky not to be adjudged caught behind first ball and was then dropped twice smashed an unbeaten to steer south africa to victory nicky boje standing in as south africa captain in graeme smith absence praised the tourists particularly streak we made it hard for ourselves but the zimbabweans came back well he said streaky is an old campaigner who knows how to play in those situations zimbabwe captain tatenda taibu said it was very important for us to fight hard and we ll carry on fighting in the test series the first of two backtoback tests begins in cape town on friday

Label: cricket
documents: denness leads luckhurst tributes former kent and england skipper mike denness has paid tribute to former teammate brian luckhurst following his death from cancer at the age of luckhurst who became kent president last year played for the club between and his international career consisted of tests and he scored two hundreds to help ray illingworth england side win the ashes in australia in he was great buddy and loyal servant denness told bbc sport in cricketing terms he probably didn have lot of natural gifts but with the gifts he had he worked so hard at it that he deserved to reach the top which he did by opening the batting for england kent chairman carl openshaw said luckhurst had been loved admired and respected by everyone at the club brian luckhurst has been at the heart of kent cricket for the past years firstly as an outstanding player then in variety of administrative capacities and finally as an immensely popular president throughout that time he was always caring loyal and totally committed to kent he continued born in sittingbourne luckhurst joined the staff at canterbury at the age of and during his firstclass career made more than firstclass runs at an average of including centuries he was member of the kent team which dominated county cricket in the when they won nine trophies outright and also shared the county championship in luckhurst was when his chance to play for england came along in home series against rest of the world xi in he was named in the ashes squad the following winter and marked his official test debut as geoff boycott opening partner by scoring and not out in draw against australia in brisbane the following game in perth saw him bat for almost six hours to score and he also made in the fifth test at melbourne as england took the series it was terrific performance and he along with geoff boycott and john edrich were the three who scored all the runs in one match think it was at melbourne he wouldn take his glove off at the break because he thought he had damaged knuckle in fact he had fractured the knuckle but he got hundred said denness luckhurst made an unbeaten in his first test on english soil against pakistan and added another century against india later in the season although he appeared in three oneday internationals his style was better suited to test cricket but he lost his place after the tour to australia when the pace and ferocity of dennis lillee and jeff thomson proved too much for england who lost it was torrid time for all of us added denness who was england captain on that tour he was great tourist great man to have and great performer if you look at his test record it a very good record after retiring from the kent first team luckhurst captained the second xi before moving into coaching and later had spell as sports centre manager in he made an unexpected return to action when kent suddenly found themselves with only players against the touring australians in recent years he worked in the club commercial department before taking on the presidency but he was diagnosed with cancer in may over the last years have faced many challenges this is going to be the biggest he said at the time luckhurst death was the third among the international cricket fraternity in the space of hours following those of former west indies batsman allan rae and exnew zealand wicketkeeper ian colquhoun

Label: cricket
documents: india top six secure ganguly captain sourav ganguly has revealed india will not be tempted into tinkering with their batting order for the first test against pakistan our batting order for the tests is fixed there are no changes from number three to six ganguly told bbc sport it means rahul dravid will remain at number three and vvs laxman at six despite the latter averaging at first drop in test cricket to be honest dravid has batted better than laxman at three ganguly added if you ask any batsman he would like to bat higher up as it gives greater opportunity to score while batting lower down the order you have to play more with the tail ganguly gave his backing to gautam gambhir banishing speculation yuvraj singh could be asked to open the batting again after failed experiment against australia last year feel there is no born opener the team has to find one he stated look at justin langer he was not an opener but how well the aussies have groomed him virender sehwag is settled opener now both in tests and onedayers and gambhir is doing well in year time we should have settled opening pair sachin tendulkar who will bat at number four with ganguly at five also received the support of his skipper despite concerns over fitness and form when sachin says he is percent fit he is and nobody has right to talk about the form of man who has international hundreds with wicketkeeper dinesh karthik to come in at number seven india are left with just four spots for bowlers suggesting yuvraj could miss out mohali which will host the first test starting on march is known as seamfriendly pitch and india have included four pacemen in their man squad in addition to spinners anil kumble and harbhajan singh india will be forced to choose from the pace quartet of irfan pathan zaheer khan ashish nehra and lakshmipathy balaji in kumble and harbhajan we have two world class spinners and at the moment there is no place for third one ganguly said our seam attack had done particularly well during the pakistan tour last year and we will select the final eleven after having look at the wickets in mohali which has had record of seaming track ganguly refused to get carried away with the fact pakistan pace attack has been depleted with the absence of shoaib akhtar through injury feel pakistan has young and fit team which is hungry for success in my view they have done the right thing by bringing fit team rather than bringing injured players he said it is better to have fully fit team than having an injured shoaib akhtar or even don bradman for that matter do not agree with those who say pakistan team is weak and has given india walkover it will be tough series and the next days will be treat for fans of both sides

Label: cricket
documents: harbhajan action given allclear indian spinner harbhajan singh bowling action has been cleared under new regulations introduced by the international cricket council bowler action is now deemed legal providing his arm straightens by no more than degrees an icc statement said harbhajan orthodox offbreak and doosra now fell within the tolerance threshold he was reported to the icc by match referee chris broad after test in bangladesh last december as result he underwent tests supervised by biomechanics expert bruce elliott of the university of western australia last month who reported back to panel of experts set up by the indian board they passed his findings on to the icc who will now circulated them to all members of the elite panel of umpires and match referees harbhajan whose action first came under scrutiny in has taken test wickets and claimed victims in oneday internationals elliott said he was confident he had bowled with similar intensity to that of test matches during the camera test we can make comparison to the video from the match when he was reported things such as ball speed arm rotation position of the body and technique he explained we had two arbiters in daryl foster and harbhajan himself to give ranking to each delivery so that we were confident they were quality deliveries

documents: streak return could lift zimbabwe oneday international port elizabeth south africa zimbabwe starts wednesday gmt trailing in the oneday series news of streak return has given the tourists lift but it is months since his last international appearance and he will rely heavily on past experience boje leads south africa in the absence of graeme smith who is resting an ankle problem ahead of the tests the home side will also be without jacques kallis shaun pollock makhaya ntini and andre nel their absence offers zimbabwe some hope of achieving only their third win in oneday meetings between the two sides the home side will give another opportunity to paceman monde zondeki who took wicket with his first ball in international cricket in december but has not been in favour since the following year tour to england he could share the new ball with charl langevedlt with allrounders albie morkel boje justin kemp and adam bacher providing the bowling backup boje capt bacher boucher wkt ab de villiers gibbs kemp langeveldt morkel prince rudolph zondeki taibu capt wkt rogers matsikenyeri masakadza taylor williams ewing mupariwa chigumbura utseya panyangara hondo mpofu cremer streak

documents: auckland set fortwenty twenty international auckland new zealand australia starts thursday gmt the black caps will be without injured daniel vettori though he is likely to play in saturday first match of the over oneday series former rugby union international jeff wilson is included in the man squad for the historic encounter australia were given boost when matthew hayden overcame pleurisy scare to be available for all matches double all black wilson who returns to the international line up after year layoff said it was no secret australia were viewed as being the toughest opponents the black caps could face the aussies are the world premier team but we re pretty accomplished oneday side too and m looking forward to being part of the challenge said wilson as team we are under no illusions about how tough it will be or how good they are but it simply matter of playing consistently well against them and grabbing all our chances although the tour focus remains firmly fixed on the opening oneday international new zealand coach john bracewell said the twenty match was good opportunity to have an early sighter of each other the twenty match might be chance to get first psychological points with long series ahead said bracewell statistics may favour new zealand who have not lost home series in four years but statistics count for nothing compared to current form where australia have an aura of invincibility australia meanwhile flew out of sydney on wednesday for the tour dismissing suggestions they already have their minds on the ashes series in england this summer the tour is australia final workout ahead of the ashes trip and while england are looming as potentially greater threat captain ricky ponting said his team were only worried about new zealand think lot of the media are talking about the ashes series but we know that we have got this very big and vital series to play first said ponting new zealand are very good side and they are hard to beat in in australia and lot harder to beat over there fleming cpt adams astle cairns mccullum wkt mcmillan marshall mills sinclair styris tuffey wilson ponting cpt gilchrist wkt hayden martyn symonds clarke katich hussey hopes hogg lee gillespie kasprowicz mcgrath

Label: cricket
documents: south africa crush zimbabwe first oneday international johannesburg south africa bt zimbabwe by runs makhaya ntini and andrew hall took three wickets apiece as the tourists were bundled out for adam bacher graeme smith and jacques rudolph laid the basis for south africa before mark boucher hit rapid in the home side poor bowling allowed the hosts to add in the last five overs although spinner prosper utseya took south africa went into the game looking to build on their recent win over england but were without shaun pollock ankle andre nel hamstring and jacques kallis who was rested ahead of the tests zimbabwe who gave debut to teenager sean williams chose to field first after skipper tatenda taibu won the toss but they had to wait overs for their first success as smith and bacher put on for the first wicket the breakthrough came when smith was trapped lbw after missing full toss from stuart matsikenyeri as he tried to swing the ball away to leg bacher fifty took balls but he only faced eight more before holing out to hamilton masakadza off utseya rudolph and herschelle gibbs put on for the third wicket but runs did not come freely as the spinners found purchase on cracked surface utseya accounted for rudolph in the th over and justin kemp quickly came and went after being easily stumped by taibu gibbs was caught off barney rogers for but boucher punished the inexperienced zimbabwe attack before being denied half century by elton chigumbura albie morkel then weighed in with off six deliveries as the innings drew to close in reply the zimbabweans were rocked by burst from newball pair ntini and hall who reduced them to it got worse when morkel claimed two wickets in an over and the match was effectively over gc smith capt am bacher ja rudolph hh gibbs ag prince jm kemp mv boucher wkt ja morkel boje aj hall ntini taibu capt wkt matsikenyeri bg rogers masakadza brm taylor maregwede chigumbura sc williams utseya panyangara cb mpofu

documents: pakistan arrive for tour of india pakistan arrived in delhi on monday amid tight security for their first full tour of india for six years the man squad along with coach bob woolmer and support staff were met at the heavily guarded indira gandhi airport after minute flight armed guards kept vigil as the tourists were taken to their hotel along sixmile route lined with security men hindu fundamentalists have threatened to protest over perceived pakistani backing to militancy in kashmir am delighted to be back in india captain inzamamulhaq said have always enjoyed playing here because people are crazy about cricket am not worried about security my only concern is how my team plays on the tour series between india and pakistan are always eagerly awaited largely because politics often restrict the amount of cricket the two teams can play against each other this particular engagement which will include three tests and six onedayers was twice threatened the schedule has already been put back four days over dispute which centred on pakistan refusal to play the second test in ahmedabad the first test in mohali will now get under way on march then following protracted row over television rights the madras high court issued interim orders to ensure the matches would be broadcast live by stateowned channel doordarshan inzamam beseeched his side to make up for the defeat to india on home soil where they lost in the tests and in the oneday internationals he said we want to make amends for last year the australian tour was big learning experience and think we are in position to reap benefits in india after the series pakistan sacked their coach javed miandad and replaced him with woolmer inzamam believes woolmer has improved the side even if string of positive results have not yet come he said lot has changed since that series woolmer has helped change the attitude of the boys which is more positive and professional and think they can take the pressure of playing in india pakistan will be without strike bowler shoaib akhtar hamstring leaving recalled offspinner arshad khan and legspinner danish kaneria with much work to do inzamam said shoaib absence will be felt but our strength is playing as unit have big role to play they are the ones on whom we will be depending lot in the test matches we are expecting slow turning tracks and we have been practicing for such conditions pakistan first match is threeday warmup against the indian board president xi in dharamsala from march sourav ganguly captain virender sehwag gautam gambhir rahul dravid sachin tendulkar vvs laxman yuvraj singh dinesh karthik wicketkeeper irfan pathan anil kumble harbhajan singh zaheer khan ashish nehra lakshmipathy balaji salman butt yasir hameed taufeeq umar younis khan inzamamulhaq captain yousuf youhana asim kamal kamran akmal wkt abdul razzaq shoaib malik shahid afridi arshad khan danish kaneria muhammad sami rana naved muhammad khalil

documents: youhana leads from front second test melbourne day one close pakistan australia standin captain yousuf youhana led the way in melbourne smashing superb ton and putting on with younis khan but the australians hit back late when youhana missed shane warne full toss and was stumped for jason gillespie the pick of the bowlers with then ousted younis and shoaib malik in quick succession younis was caught behind by adam gilchrist off gillespie first delivery with the second new ball for and the paceman struck again in his next over when malik was caught at slip by ricky ponting for seven pakistan losing three wickets for just runs abdul razzaq was not out on one and kamran akmal unbeaten on at the close of play earlier salman butt hit his maiden test halfcentury as he put on for the first wicket with imran farhat michael kasprowicz claimed the only wicket to fall before lunch when he had farhat brilliantly caught by ponting at slip for but the hosts struck straight after the interval when yasir hameed was trapped leg before by gillespie for two butt brave knock came to an end when he was run out by superb throw from michael clarke going for second run the opener had made and his dismissal left pakistan struggling on but youhana filling in as captain for the injured inzamamulhaq and younis steadied the ship australia who were lifted before the start of play by news that inform opener justin langer was fit enough to take his place in the side won the first test in perth by runs overall pakistan have only won four times in tests played in australia although two of those successes came at the mcg l langer l hayden t ponting capt r martyn s lehmann j clarke c gilchrist wkt k warne n gillespie s kasprowicz d mcgrath salman butt imran farhat younis khan yousuf youhana capt yasir hameed shoaib malik abdul razzaq kamran akmal wkt mohammad sami shoaib akhtar danish kaneria e koertzen and w lloyds

Label: cricket
documents: england victory tainted by history as england attempt to secure series victory in south africa they will do so at the venue for previous match which became the stuff of test cricket folklore south africa meeting with england at centurion park in january was thought to have been an enthralling spectacle with the tourists claiming remarkable win after three whole days were lost to bad weather it took few short months to reveal the unfortunate truth that bookmaker had given home skipper hansie cronje money and leather jacket to influence the outcome of the match cronje who was killed two years later in plane crash was subsequently found guilty of matchfixing and banned from test cricket for life opening the bowling for england was andy caddick who told bbc sport they were up in the series we had lot of english supporters there and south africa just wanted to make game of it that what thought at the time you don think anything of it but then afterwards you start to put two and two together with events that happened afterwards england captain nasser hussain put the south africans in after winning the toss and was given an early reward of purely cricketing nature when gary kirsten edged darren gough to second slip for duck in the first over cronje also fell to gough for duck as the home side closed the first day the next three days were then wiped out competely due to combination of rain and damp ground conditions before cronje approached hussain with suggestion to manufacture result south africa had already secured the series having won in johannesburg and cape town but cronje and his friends wanted to create some interest in the final day at centurion the idea was for each side to forfeit an innings each leaving the tourists with run chase so south africa reached on the final morning to set england from overs kirsten was one of several players opposed to the move as he explained to bbc sport hansie came up to us in the changing room on the last day and said m keen to forfeit the innings and set the total he asked the team and there was mixed reception some of the guys felt we didn want to give england chance of winning you don mess around with test matches and some said nothing hansie just decided and maybe we know why in hindsight to go for it but there was quite bit of resistance and some of the guys didn think it was good idea at all england th man that day was phil tufnell who recalled everyone thought it was very good gesture in the spirit of the game the game had meandered along and all of sudden it was like an old fashioned threeday county game and we were having chase whatever the reasons later it emerged that cronje part had been simply to ensure against draw it led to fascinating cricket match england needed six from the final seven balls and yorkshire tailenders chris silverwood and darren gough both hit boundaries to give them twowicket victory it ended as great day for cricket kirsten conceded one could argue it was good for people who had been frustrated having not watched any cricket and suddenly got great last day but from player point of view you ve worked so hard for three months trying to win test series that you don give test matches away or create the opportunity to make it easy to win one tufnell has favourable memories of cronje who played county cricket for leicestershire in the he always came across as nice bloke the spinner said he always came and said hi and seemed very intelligent captain good competitor and good ambassador for south african cricket kirsten too recalls some positive images of cronje we all know that what he did cannot be condoned in any circumstances he said but my view is he did huge amount for my career thought he was an outstanding captain and ve made mistakes in my life so m not in position to be judgemental

Label: cricket
documents: world xi win tsunami match tsunami appeal match melbourne icc world xi beat asian xi by runs ricky ponting hit in massive total of after electing to bat first in front of crowd of rahul dravid topscored with not out in the asian xi reply after virender sehwag brisk daniel vettori took while england darren gough took wicket and catch shane warne had the game broadcast in countries to an estimated global television audience of one billion began with minute silence for the victims of the tsunami australian prime minister john howard tossed coin to start the match and afterwards the international cricket council chief executive malcolm speed paid tribute to the players for taking part he said this signifies the game compassion and commitment to provide as much help as possible to enable the survivors of the tsunami to rebuild their lives so far as this is possible ponting entertained the fans early on by hitting some big shots off anil kumble and abdul razzaq and the world xi run rate was soon ticking along at healthy rate chris cairns and brian lara enjoyed themselves as middle order packed with stars delivered the goods and there was plenty of time for the unorthodox australia tailender glenn mcgrath batted at number six where he fell for golden duck muttiah muralitharan captured his wicket in overall figures of it was welcome comeback performance from the sri lankan who had been out injured for five months and who was almost caught up in the december tragedy sehwag gave the asian xi good start as they reached in the th over but wickets regularly tumbled once he fell to catch in the deep trying to hit warne second ball for six vettori got stuck into the middle order where dravid played lone hand with only kumar sangakkara gough sole victim providing any meaningful support the world xi were further boosted by the presence of steve waugh as substitute fielder towards the end of the match it was all wrapped up in the th over with the run out of murali for duck man of the match ponting said the whole day has been very very special it great that the cricket community around the world can play huge part to raise some money to put smile on some faces around the world asian xi captain sourav ganguly said hope we have contributed in whatever way we can to help the people who have suffered this disaster sourav ganguly indcapt sanath jayasuriya sl virender sehwag ind rahul dravid ind yousuf youhana pak kumar sangakkara sl abdul razzaq pak chaminda vaas sl zaheer khan ind anil kumble ind muttiah muralitharan sl alok kapali ban th man sachin tendulkar ind th man ricky ponting auscapt matthew hayden aus adam gilchrist aus stephen fleming nz brian lara wi chris gayle wi chris cairns nz shane warne aus glenn mcgrath aus darren gough eng daniel vettori nz dwayne bravo wi th man rudi koertzen sa billy bowden nz

Label: cricket
documents: murali to miss onedayers in nz sri lanka have put back plans to take spinner muttiah muralitharan on the oneday leg of their new zealand tour muralitharan was to have travelled with the team as part of his rehabilitation from shoulder surgery but now needs to prove his fitness before joining them he will aim to play in practice match in sri lanka on december two weeks before the first test in auckland the off spinner resumed bowling last week and is currently bowling balls every other day in the nets sri lanka begin their tour of new zealand on december playing two tests and five oneday internationals surgeon david young operated on muralitharan in august to treat lesion which had caused buildup of fluid around the nerves in his right shoulder at the time of his injury muralitharan held the world record of test wickets which has since been surpassed by australia shane warne

Label: cricket
documents: bskyb lands england deal live coverage of england home test matches will no longer be available on terrestrial tv from onwards the england and wales cricket board has awarded an exclusive fouryear contract to bskyb which will run until highlights of each day play in the test matches will however be screened on five which replaces channel as cricket sole terrestrial broadcaster the bbc has retained the exclusive rights for radio coverage of home tests and oneday internationals england and wales cricket board chairman david morgan said the various deals would be worth xcxam real terms increase on the previous agreements for we understand that the decision to place all live cricket coverage on satellite and cable television is an emotive issue for some people he continued we have made an agreement that will offer the highlights package to peaktime audience five will broadcast highlights from pm time which is the most popular slot for tv viewing for children and time when an average of people watch television bskyb package also covers oneday twenty and women internationals as well as county cricket channel has screened england home test matches since when they ended the bbc year tenure and the decision to prevent cricket from being seen live by terrestrial tv audience is calculated gamble by the ecb former england captain alec stewart speaking on tuesday said young girls and boys should be able to see cricket without having to pay for it the ecb have to look at the whole picture they may be getting big cheque but longterm english cricket will suffer and morgan predecessor lord maclaurin had also called for balance between satellite and terrestrial tv think there is big dangerof depriving an awful lot of people of watching test cricket he commented but the ecb believes strong financial base is essential to the game wellbeing the bids we accepted allow us to invest even more in the development of the england team and grass roots cricket other proposals included live coverage of some international cricket on terrestrial tv but if accepted they would have resulted in significant financial shortfall for the game and it was decided that this was not in the best interest of the sport explained morgan this is very good deal for cricket as it guarantees wide accessibility to watch or listen to the action and secures the future development of the game from playground to test arena commenting on the bbc renewed agreement with the ecb director of sport peter salmon said with the england team on top form we are pleased to provide listeners with the most comprehensive radio coverage on test match special the bbc will also have nonexclusive rights to cover the cg trophy and twenty cup the later shared with the wireless group which owns talksport radio test series covered by the new contract sri lanka and pakistan west indies and india zimbabwe and south africa new zealand and australia

Label: cricket
documents: sri lanka decide to continue tour sri lanka are to continue their cricket tour to new zealand after fiveday period of mourning for those killed by the tidal waves in south asia the death toll is now at around almost half of them sri lankans and many more are still missing cricket is not the thing on our minds at the moment said team manager brendon kuruppu wednesday game in napier has been postponed but the sri lankan board decided the tour should go on the oneday series will now resume on january in queenstown the match in napier will now be played on january and the test series which was due to begin on the th will also be rescheduled new zealand cricket has great compassion for the people of sri lanka and what they have suffered during this terrible time said nzc chief executive martin snedden it is testament to the strong relationship between the two boards that they have worked together to quickly find workable solution john bracewell coach of the new zealand team said his players had been deeply moved by the disaster and their thoughts were with the sri lankan squad it a shock to everyone and our sympathies do go out to them he said ve no doubt our guys will talk to their guys about it it pretty rough the sri lanka under team tour to pakistan has been postponed we can understand that in their current state of affairs they are in no position to play cricket series said pakistan cricket board chairman shaharyar khan the indian and australian women teams will however play oneday match in madras as planned on tuesday

Label: cricket
documents: pietersen handed oneday callup kevin pietersen has been added to the england squad for the forthcoming oneday series in south africa the hampshire batsman who was born in south africa made his england debut in zimbabwe last november it is prudent to add him to the squad as the team face seven oneday internationals in days said chairman of selectors david graveney his inclusion will give the captain and coach another option if the side requires different balance pietersen spent four years qualifying to play for england after beginning his career in south african provincial cricket with kwazulunatal he was prolific scorer in four seasons with nottinghamshire and was the star of the england tour to india early last year when he scored three centuries his introduction to the senior side came on the controversial tour to zimbabwe where he showed his potential with an innings of not out off balls in the second match as england achieved clean sweep but he can except rough ride from south africa whose skipper graeme smith accused pietersen of running out when things got tough in magazine interview last autumn if he didn want to be here then we don want him here smith was quoted as saying we all know that south africa went through transformation that wasimportant for our country we had to come from apartheid and move on there was always going to be difficult stage we all went through it and some fantastic cricketers haveemerged the oneday series starts in johannesburg on january three days after england sole warmup game against south africa m vaughan capt kabir ali anderson batty bell collingwood flintoff giles gough harmison jones wkt pietersen solanki strauss trescothick wharf

Label: cricket
documents: cricket coach moves on after tsunami when the tsunami crashed onto the sri lankan coastline cricket coach stephen jones was in the middle of catching practice within minutes the entire playing area at the galle stadium was covered by water but jones and the boys of the harrow school team made it to safety just in time thousands were not so lucky and now almost month later jones is still coming to terms with the experience but he must do so whilst concentrating on his next coaching assignment to prepare the south african team for the women world cup starting in march jones admits his memory of events in galle is still blur he told bbc sport we were about half an hour from starting our game and were warming up fortunately we were doing fielding drills right in front of the pavilion had we been doing them anywhere else on the field we would have been in trouble remember the level of noise going up and colleague wife and daughter screamed at us to watch out was told and this don remember that one of the locals came up to me and told me to get off the field it probably took only five minutes maybe minutes for the water to get to about five metres deep the harrow party took refuge in viewing area next to the changing rooms which proved high enough the boys were terrified we were all terrified but they were amazingly calm said jones thought afterwards that if one of them had panicked it might just have set off domino effect and we could have been in trouble if it had happened at the beginning of the tour it might have been different but think the fact that we had been around together as team counted in our favour the team ethic of looking out for each other really came to the fore the yearold from cape town believes his perspective on life has changed but he is conscious of the significance of the women world cup which south africa is hosting and the need to do his utmost to focus fully on helping team which has not played international cricket for year m aware of the fact that perhaps women cricket here is little bit more in its infancy than in other countries there a little bit further to go this world cup is critical if it a success and gets the exposure hope it does it can elevate women cricket here to brand new level he said perhaps m going to be bit more relaxed about it than might have been and see it in its bigger context see the bigger picture but it nice to achieve things as well and it important for the girls to make good go of it and make it special occasion

Label: cricket
documents: sri lanka squad sets off for home sri lanka cricketers have set off for home after the cancellation of their tour to new zealand the decision was taken by the two boards in the wake of the devastating tsunami in south asia which claimed the lives of over sri lankans there is lot of work to be done it won be done in couple of days it will take months maybe years we just need to help them in whatever way we can vicecaptain mahela jayawardene said sri lanka played only one of series of five oneday internationals in new zealand and two test matches were also called off the tour will be rescheduled at time to be agreed by the two boards the general feeling with everyone is that this was the right thing to do cricket is just not important at the moment said team manager brendon kuruppu noone has been thinking about cricket the players have just been staying in their hotel rooms watching everything on television and trying to phone home to get information star spin bowler muttiah muralitharan came within minutes of being caught up in the huge tidal waves which swept across the sri lankan coastline at galle he is still recuperating from shoulder surgery missed the wave by minutes had only just left galle so am very luck to be alive he told the sydney morning herald newspaper new zealand cricket meanwhile have agreed to allow the world vision charity to raise funds through their website they also plan to donate nz xcxa for every ticket sold for their twenty match against australia on february to the disaster appeal the kiwi players will also be donating signed shirts they wear for the game in auckland for auction

Label: cricket
documents: england claim historic series win fifth test centurion day five south africa drew with england england win fivematch series centuries from jacques kallis and ab de villiers allowed south africa to declare on setting england target of to win from overs the tourists chose not to chase the runs however finishing on there were plenty of nervous moments when they lost early wickets but captain michael vaughan held firm to secure series triumph though the usually brilliant andrew strauss scored duck only denis compton had ever scored more runs in series against south africa and he won the manoftheseries award for his three centuries kallis and manofthematch de villiers were in occupation of the crease when the day started with south africa still trailing by runs by the time they had been parted they had added for the third wicket the scoring rate was never sensational however as vaughan declined to set overattacking fields and the batsman refused to take undue risks it took more than an hour for the lead to be wiped off as de villiers hit arguably the shot of the day pull off matthew hoggard that went all the way for six the remaining hourandahalf of an extended morning session saw further runs added the two righthanders were quick to pull and drive when the opportunities presented themselves kallis was twice lucky to survive at one point he edged hoggard inches short of marcus trescothick at slip and then on looked lucky to survive an lbw appeal against simon jones de villiers reached his halfcentury with square drive off ashley giles for four and he continued to play the spinner with great certainty in the afternoon session it was widely assumed south africa would throw the bat at almost everything first however both batsmen needed to reach their centuries kallis got there first cutting jones for four it was his fifth test ton against england and th in all the yearold de villiers became the third youngest south african to hit test century with boundary in the same area off the same bowler but he then perished when holing out to third man off jones he had made off balls oddly kallis took stock for while before launching few more boundaries shortly before the declaration finally finishing unbeaten on in the hunt for quick runs graeme smith jacques rudolph and mark boucher all perished for single figure scores grateful steve harmison took his first two wickets since cape town and hoggard added single victim to finish with in the series set from overs england were never in position to go for the target once strauss had been caught behind in ntini first over things looked dicey when robert key provided just minutes of uncertain resistance before edging pollock to boucher and there were certainly few skipped heartbeats in the england dressingroom when trescothick inexplicably missed straight ball from ntini to be bowled that left overs remaining for south africa to try to find the last seven wickets vaughan and graham thorpe however proved adept at blunting some impressive spells from all the bowlers until ntini returned to have thorpe caught by herschelle gibbs who was close in at third slip england had just about done enough by then and the game ended in bad light twoandhalf overs early with vaughan not out and andrew flintoff unbeaten on it was england first series win in south africa since mjk smith led them to win in and it earned them the basil oliveira trophy named after the player who the south african apartheid regime refused to allow to tour their country with england in ultimately resulting in their exclusion from international sport graeme smith capt herschelle gibbs jacques rudolph jacques kallis ab de villiers mark boucher wkt andrew hall nicky boje shaun pollock makhaya ntini andre nel marcus trescothick andrew strauss robert key michael vaughan capt graham thorpe andrew flintoff geraint jones wkt ashley giles matthew hoggard steve harmison simon jones sa bucknor wi aleem dar pkn

documents: injured butcher out of tour mark butcher has been ruled out of the rest of england tour of south africa with sprained left wrist and andrew flintoff has yet to prove his bowling fitness for the fourth test which starts on thursday after suffering an abdominal muscle tear flintoff batted in the nets but will not attempt to bowl until tuesday and could play solely as batsman butcher will fly home later this week to be replaced by ian bell who played single test last year mark will see specialist in johannesburg and fly home in the next few days said england media manager dave clarke he tried to have bat in the nets this morning but was unable to grip the bat butcher has endured year beset by back and neck trouble have been despondent about things since last summer when got those injuries but this feels much worse he said had been quite hopeful after the swelling had gone down but there was no chance of me getting through for this match was struggling with few throwdowns with tennis balls and there was no chance could have played cricket balls without discomfort if flintoff cannot bowl england could call seamer james anderson into the xi at the expense of spinner ashley giles or include paul collingwood batsman who bowls mediumpace that could mean robert key who replaced butcher for the third test missing out england had two days off in cape town after the run defeat their first test reverse since december before flying to johannesburg on sunday meanwhile michael vaughan has revealed he is considering sending another member of the team to the prematch coin toss vaughan has won just six of tosses as skipper can designate someone else to go out there if want to said vaughan m giving it some thought because noone can do worse than me

documents: ashes defeat won hurt aussies australia great rodney marsh says it would do his country no harm if they were to return from england in september having lost the ashes in the big picture england need to be strong said marsh who steps down as director of england national academy in september so it won do australia or the game any harm if they lose the ashes if people back home cannot understand that that tough he told the daily telegraph newspaper marsh flew out on wednesday to dubai as coach of the england team for their tour of the united arab emirates and sri lanka he has been employed by the england and wales cricket board as academy director since and subsequently as selector by the time leave the ecb would like to think had played small part in making england more competitive though the players are the ones who have done the work he said australia have won the past eight ashes series and are the world topranked team the fivetest ashes series begins at lord on july

documents: england duo hit centuries second test durban day three close england south africa both hit strauss was unbeaten as england finished day three ahead on having started it behind it was the th run opening stand in england history and by the time trescothick was bowled by shaun pollock it was the country fifth best ever mark butcher was strauss partner at stumps in durban unbeaten on one trescothick bludgeoned fours and two sixes in his ball innings with strauss hitting boundaries from balls faced it was the duo fourth stand of or more and their best return in nine tests together bettering the they shared against new zealand at lord this summer in what had been lowscoring game england started the day on and seemingly with mountain to climb but allied to some loose bowling the vagaries of the pitch which had hindered them on day one had disappeared to make life easier for england the firstwicket pair was circumspect in the opening minutes of play but soon feasted on the tripe served up by dale steyn whose threeover spell cost runs the rookie paceman bowled short and wide inviting strauss to hook at will and trescothick to take him for three successive boundaries through the offside the transformation of england and indeed the pitch was illustrated by their lunch score of just two runs fewer than their entire firstinnings effort south africa looked seriously bereft of options in the afternoon with skipper graeme smith fruitlessly turning to himself steyn returning to the attack and nicky boje failing to threaten pollock was the only one to bother england rampant openers beating the outside edge of both batsmen but there was to be no moving the batsmen as they rose through the ranks of england greatest firstwicket stands england previous best in durban by wally hammond and bob wyatt years ago fell away and runs later new record for all teams at the ground was set when the run mark was passed it was the first time england opening wicket had done so since graeme gooch and mike atherton against australia in the openers reached triple figures within moments of each other trescothick for the ninth time and strauss for the fourth and second in two tests both carried on in the same vein after tea with trescothick hoicking boje over midwicket for six and strauss striking successive fours in the same over south africa only hope looked to be the new ball and the dependable pollock finally gave the hosts something to cheer when trescothick edged simple catch behind late on strauss chanceless all day next over gave south africa sniff when edging ntini low down to second slip where martin van jaarsveld spilled tough onehanded chance bad light ceased play overs ahead of schedule and play will start minutes early on day four graeme smith documents: kallis keen on glamorgan return south africa star batsman jacques kallis says he would relish return to county cricket with glamorgan want break after the west indies tour but in the future want to return to county cricket and glamorgan are my first choice said kallis thoroughly enjoyed my time in cardiff and hope to go back the yearold rated the numberone batsman in the world after stunning year spent successful season with the welsh county in he has starred for south africa in the series with england averaging with the bat but knows he has job to do with his side down heading into the final test in pretoria we re under lot more pressure than england but we re determined to draw the series kallis told bbc sport wales england did it to us in the final test of the last series between the sides now it our turn to come out and win the game losing the last test was very frustrating the batting let us down to get bowled out in two sessions on that type of wicket was not good enough we played good cricket until then and felt we had the chance to win the game despite his desire to return to county cricket in the future kallis admitted that the demands of the international game were taking its toll and called for reassessment of the fixture calendar he is keen to carry on with his bowling though and still sees his future as an allrounder enjoy my bowling he said ve worked hard on it and hope to keep it going for few years yet

who scored his maiden test fifty this australian summer registered his highest oneday score off just balls striking two fours and six katich and gillespie were two of three changes to the aussie side haddin was bowled by dwayne bravo but it was not until lee and gillespie were brought together by collins removal of katich in the th over that australia really got on top losing both openers inside Label: cricket
documents: ecb reveals county oneday revamp the england and wales cricket board has announced major structural changes to two domestic oneday competitions but the board has resisted calls to cut the number of fourday games with the county championship format unchanged from the over cg trophy will be divided into two conferences with scotland and ireland added it will be played in the first half of the season with an august final while the totesport league will occupy the end of the summer in over format however the scottish saltires who have finished bottom in two seasons in division two will be removed from the competition after the nine teams in each totesport league division will play each other just once either home or away with automatic twoup and twodown promotion and relegation spots the thirdplaced team in division two will host the seventhplaced team in division one in oneoff match to decide the final topflight berth an expansion of the twenty cup was already planned for and the ecb is to explore adding two further foreign teams in the future first class forum chairman mike soper headed the working party responsible for the changes after initial suggestions by the ecb were rejected by county bosses am extremely pleased with the outcome of this report which was unanimously acclaimed at the recent fcf meeting he said we will now have strong competition in the cg trophy which reflects international cricket our highly successful twenty competition will have over competition immediately following it following model set in australia and south africa the england team will face touring sides each summer either playing two firstclass matches or combination of four and oneday games

Label: cricket
documents: ireland happy with new cg format ireland will be guaranteed nine cg trophy matches from when the competition changes from straight knockout to league format and skipper jason molins said the new structure was great boost to the development of irish cricket it is something we have been pushing for we need to play more often as unit and against better opposition said the irish captain the opportunity to play this sort of cricket is really exciting the new competition will be played in the first half of the season apart from the final and ireland will be in the southern conference with nine firstclass counties scotland have been invited to take part in the northern section world cricket at the moment is eight or nine tams playing oneday internationals added molins if ireland want to aspire to that level we have got to be playing more oneday matches against good teams irish cricket has invested heavily in national coach and chief executive we need to be playing more games ireland have lot of young players coming through and this will help give them platform and more profile as part of irelands preparation for the icc trophy in july the irish cricket union have secured fixture against the current english county champions warwickshire the match will be played at edgbaston on sunday april

documents: ganguly plays down fears india captain sourav ganguly has attempted to play down safety fears over their tour to bangladesh the indian squad arrived in dhaka on wednesday for day tour featuring two tests and three oneday matches the first test has already been put back day to friday after the indian embassy received threats purporting to come from islamic militants security is an important factor but we as team are concentrating on cricket and nothing else ganguly insisted handwritten fax allegedly sent by the harkatulzihad group threatened to kill indian cricketers but has been dismissed as hoax by the bangladesh authorities they are suspected of carrying out the assasination of poet shamsur rahman six years ago the group hostility towards india stems from riots in the western state of gujarat in which left people dead many of them muslims the board of control for cricket in india is leaving nothing to chance and are sending security experts to assess the situation in chittagong where the second test is due to start on december despite bangladesh mediocre record of defeats in matches at test level since ganguly said his team would take nothing for granted don think bangladesh are pushovers always respect the opposition and bangladesh are no exception don think any side has has gone and played in bangladesh with sense of complacency india were bangladesh first test opponents four years ago winning by nine wickets in dhaka despite the home side making in their first innings

documents: sri lankans cleared of misconduct two sri lanka cricketers have been cleared of misconduct dating back to the icc champions trophy in avishka gunawardene and kaushal lokuarachchi were both the subject of an official disciplinary inquiry after allegations of drunken misconduct colombo newspaper had made the claims after defeat against england in southampton which led to sri lanka exiting the tournament early but the disciplinary panel could find no evidence against the players sri lanka cricket chief executive duleep mendis said nobody was prepared to give evidence and there was absolutely no evidence to substantiate the article allegations gunawardene hardhitting opener and lokuarachchi yearold legspinning allrounder were both dropped from the national squad after sri lanka tour of pakistan in october

documents: boycott slams chucking plan geoff boycott has condemned the international cricket council proposal to relax rules on chucking the former england batsman said the move was made to benefit sri lanka spinner muttiah muralitharan whose doosra ball could soon be legal think it been brought in through pressure from sri lanka and murali supporters boycott told bbc sport it a sad day for cricket that this pressure can allow muralitharan to bowl whatever he wants degree flexing of the arm will be permitted following an extensive research programme conducted by biomechanics experts previously only degrees for fast bowlers and five degrees for spinners were permitted murali arm was measured at degrees while bowling his doosra prior to the delivery banning sri lanka cricket said such accusations were wide of the mark and that the rule change would be made to benefit all bowlers it is bit unfair spokesman told bbc sport we have always said that many things need to be considered but we have never pressured the icc and the decision is not only for murali it is for all we are very happy about it as it means murali will be able bowl his doosra sri lanka cricket appreciates it very much and we thank the icc for making such decision the icc executive will be asked to ratify the recommendations made by panel comprising aravinda de silva angus fraser michael holding tony lewis tim may and the icc own david richardson the panel met in dubai and studied video evidence of bowlers as well as hearing the opinions of the three biomechanical experts the scientific evidence is overwhelming holding said when bowlers who to the naked eye look to have pure actions are thoroughly analysed with the sophisticated technology now in place they are likely to be shown as straightening their arm by and in some cases degrees under strict interpretation of the law these players are breaking the rules the game needs to deal with this reality and make its judgment as to how it accommodates this fact de silva tipped fellow sri lankan murali the secondhighest test wickettaker with victims to raise the bar even higher he has so much cricket left in him that have little doubt that murali will reach the wicket mark in test cricket he said the icc has done the right thing and he can go ahead with his usual repertoire of bowling am glad for murali who will be relieved man now

documents: sri lanka cancel tour sri lanka have cancelled their cricket tour of new zealand following the tsunami disaster that has ravaged the country it has been confirmed the tour had been put on hold after the first oneday international game was played on december the same day the tidal wave struck the island country sri lanka cricket initially said it would postpone the tour but on wednesday decided to pull out we fully understand the decision said icc chief executive malcolm speed the latest death toll for sri lankans caught up in the disaster stands at statement from sri lanka cricket stated the sri lankan cricketers have always stood by the people of this country in good times and bad times the cancellation of this tour will enable the cricketers to help the board assist victims of the disaster speed said the impact of the tsunami on sri lanka has been devastating in this situation where two of our members have agreed to postpone the series there is no issue of fines or compensation the sri lankan players will now be able to return to their families and the series will be replayed at date in the future to be confirmed the tour comprising oneday internationals and test matches will now be rescheduled by both cricket boards by mutual agreement none of the sri lanka squad lost family members in the disaster but the mothers of sanath jayasuriya and upul chandana are believed to have been injured star spin bowler muttiah muralitharan meanwhile came within minutes of being caught up in the huge tidal waves which swept across the sri lankan coastline at galle missed the wave by minutes had only just left galle so am very lucky to be alive he said having had to miss the early part of the tour due to injury new zealand cricket chief executive martin snedden said we will now give the sri lankan cricket team every assistance to return home as soon as possible as the magnitude of the recent events in sri lanka has unfolded it has become more difficult for the sri lankan team to remain in new zealand

documents: kenya cricket boss fights sacking kenya cricket association president sharad ghai has obtained court order preventing his dismissal by the government over financial allegations ghai was accused of failing to account for sponsorship money resolve player disputes or hold regular elections sports minister ochillo ayacko has appointed caretaker committee headed by issac kalua to serve for three months before new elections take place but the order prevents kalua moving in for days pending judicial review ghai insisted his committee had always submitted receipts and audited accounts of its expenditure he has refused to hand over the office keys to kalua and was angered when the interim committee broke into the building under police supervision what we are saying is that this should have been done ina dignified manner he protested there was supposed to be date and time set for office handover and this is what is expected to happen in any civil society it is not the first time the government has made accusations of financial mismanagement against the board in they disbanded the committee but court reinstated the officials

over and both openers had recorded boundaries when in the ninth over slower ball from gough accounted for stuart matsikenyeri with the score on two overs later alex wharf picked up fortuitous wicket with his fifth delivery when brendan taylor dragged wide one onto the timbers far more dangerous delivery accounted for vusi sibanda who was unable to keep out rising ball the hosts had brief period of consolidation only to ruin it with runout as mark vermeulen was left short of his ground by direct throw from andrew strauss when tatenda taibu became the third batsmen to drag on something special was required and briefly it came from chigumbura the lissome righthander launched series of clean straightbladed shots hammering six fours and magnificent straight six off wharf in his minute innings ebrahim was beaten in the flight by ashley giles then in the next over chigumbura went for one lofted drive too many and was caught deep in the covers crowd of around had been delighted with his efforts but when he departed at there was little else from the tail gough wrapping up the innings with yorker in the final over england reply began smoothly until vikram solanki mistimed drive that looped to midoff for seven vaughan gradually unveiled some trademark strokes of classic nature in ball innings featuring five fours and six he departed in the th over with still needed caught at deep midwicket by chigumbura who in the same position had spilled chance offered by bell four overs earlier andrew strauss was soon back in the pavilion offering simple return catch to matsikenyeri to leave england having seemed set to guide his team home bell composed innings ended runs short of the victory target when he edged his th delivery to taibu paul collingwood needlessly pressed for second run and fell to sharp throw from utseya at leg gully then next ball geraint jones almost joined him after hesitation with kevin pietersen the debutant was content to edge england home in conservative fashion but won it with his only boundary straight down the ground as the tourists finally secured their ninth successive win over zimbabwe

documents: pakistan urged to show more fight the head of the pakistan cricket board has warned the national team they are playing for their places in the two remaining tests in australia pakistan suffered run thrashing in perth where they were bowled out for just in their second innings pakistan is proud cricket nation and we want some continuity in the team but if the current lot can pick themselves up we will look at our reserve talent for future tours said pcb chairman shaharyar khan we know that under new coach bob woolmer the players need time to adjust to new system and method but we at least expect them to put up good fight he added crowd of about meanwhile burnt effigies of woolmer captain inzamamulhaq vicecaptain yousuf youhana and chief selector wasim bari in karachi on tuesday and former coach javed miandad has renewed his criticism of woolmer who took charge of the team only six months ago the team has some talented players and all they need is to make minor adjustments to their techniques and play with heart on australian wickets but think the coach also needs to stop blaming the players and making excuses for every poor performance woolmer is highly regarded coach and he needs to back his players and give them confidence at all times pakistan have lost four of the six tests they have played so far this year the second test against australia begins in melbourne on sunday

Label: cricket
documents: england need to regroup south africa duly levelled the series in midafternoon when england unlikely top scorer steve harmison was caught in the gully for england now have three days of relaxation in cape town in which to contemplate their first defeat in matches before heading to johannesburg for the fourth test coach duncan fletcher main problem is that only handful of players are currently pulling their weight of the bowlers matthew hoggard is plugging away manfully but he and andrew flintoff appear to be the only seam bowlers michael vaughan feels he can trust at present simon jones is bowling steadily enough yet vaughan seems to bring him on only as last resort while harmison remains shadow of the bowler who until this tour topped the world rankings spinner ashley giles was more consistent in cape town than in the previous test but rarely looked threatening the lack of application of the batsmen however has been the principle reason for england having lost their lead andrew strauss and marcus trescothick can be excused criticism but even they would admit that along with all the others their wickets have been given away far too easily what must really frustrate fletcher is that south africa bowling attack is little more than workmanlike and should not have dismissed england for in their first innings in durban and in the first innings here on wearing pitch they still needed overs to bowl england out second time and the last wicket pair of harmison and hoggard were able to add with little difficulty at least the news of andrew flintoff injury is encouraging an mri scan revealed that his problem is an abdominal strain rather than intercostal had it been the latter it would have ended his tour at stroke but the belief now is that with treatment he should be fit to bowl in johannesburg if the injury does not recover in time england face the nightmare of trying to choose balanced team mark butcher prognosis does not appear to be as promising he is wearing cast on his left wrist which will be removed next week but time seems to be running out for him neutral observers still believe that england are the better team but having avoided defeat in durban and scored resounding victory here south africa now have the force with them

documents: scotland take small step into the big time there was no winner cheque on offer and no increase in status just trip to sharjah shiny trophy and the prestige of being considered the thbest team in world cricket but scotland were still celebrating heartily after winning the icc intercontinental cup beating kenya and canada in the final stages in the united arab emirates men in suits can talk for as long as they like about infrastructure and development pathways but sport is about winning and scotland came through where it mattered pace bowler john blain who was man of the match in the final after taking seven wickets fully realised the importance of an innings victory over canada we ve been moving on for number of years now narrowly missing out on the world cup but this is the nextbest thing he told bbc sport we ve always been confident of what ability we have but it about getting results the victory means more than some silverware for the cabinet however for team that appeared in the world cup but has not made highlight reels since the majority of the side are still amateurs and as blain pointed out it very difficult for guys to go from the world cup back to their jobs and keep the standard up the international cricket council is keen to improve the strength and depth behind the testplaying nations and this is just part of its development programme five associate member countries will appear in the world cup and the authorities are keen they should provide more than secondround bye for the bigger sides senior coach bob woolmer suggested that the threeday format would help hone skills for the limitedovers game blain gives the idea the thumbsup but also believes scotland exposure to english county cricket national league ncl has helped the guys have come here and played the cricket that they ve been playing the last couple of years in the ncl but in longer version of the game he said they ve learned how to be ruthless and go for the victory with some controversy this tournament was given firstclass status although only handful of players including blain and durham gavin hamilton normally play at that level with kenya lacking players because of pay dispute and canada losing world cup star john davison to australian domestic duty the standard was below county level however blain argued ve had sevenwicket hauls in county cricket but this must rate among them it international cricket and it the top of the tree this win will help strengthen scotland claim for fulltime oneday international status saving them from the qualification process they will have to prove themselves again next april when the icc trophy in ireland will act as world cup qualifier but blain believes consistency is building results are now starting to show we have squad of boys who can compete he continued we ve got more exposure now and the standard has moved on fantastically which will stand us in good stead when we go on to the qualifiers the intercontinental cup is not an end in itself but significant milestone along the way

documents: australia dominate india third test nagpur day two stumps australia india the home side closed on runs in arrears and still short of avoiding the followon glenn mcgrath playing in his th test took in overs as mohammad kaif not out propped up an innings that crawled at two runs per over australia were earlier dismissed for with michael clarke falling to zaheer khan nine short of ton india did not take long in wrapping up australia innings at the start of the day claiming the three remaining overnight wickets for runs jason gillespie lbw to zaheer and kasprowicz bowled by agit agarkar both fell cheaply leaving mcgrath as clarke last hope of second test century the veteran enjoyed his stay at the crease with two hooked boundaries and in the end it was he who remained unbeaten when clarke edged behind to end an entertaining knock that included boundaries india were given typically blustery start by virender sehwag who took four boundaries off gillespie first over it forced skipper adam gilchrist to protect the boundary with sweeper after just five overs but having forced australia on the defensive sehwag soon gave his wicket away flashing hard at mcgrath the opener became the aussie paceman th victim when edging into the gloves of the athletic gilchrist diving high to his right gillespie belted out of the attack by sehwag returned from the other end and struck immediately to have aakash chopra caught by warne at slip for eight it left india at lunch and very quiet period followed the interval as rahul dravid and the returning sachin tendulkar tried to block india to parity the pair put on runs in one ball shy of dawdling overs before tendulkar was trapped in front of stumps by gillespie for eight the grassy nagpur pitch meant shane warne introduction was delayed until the th over but two balls were all it took for the test cricket leading wickettaker to add to his tally in having vvs laxman caught by clarke in gully warne ousted him for the third time this series and reduced india to perilous in the process dravid stay at the crease was lengthy one but largely unproductive and after consuming balls for runs he edged mcgrath to slip it was predictable end after the veteran paceman had worked india standin skipper over with an array of balls which leapt off the seam on pitch more akin to australian grounds at india looked vulnerable but kaif and parthiv patel fresh from their century stand in the second test showed heart in the fading light it was not plain sailing for kaif spurned runout chance and catch off noball offered two reprieves but he grew into his task and even managed six off warne over longoff although india sixth wicket offered the home side hope australia were in strong position to push for the victory that would award them first series victory in india for years chopra sehwag dravid capt r tendulkar v laxman kaif a patel wkt b agarkar kumble kartik khan l hayden l langer m katich r martyn s lehmann j clarke c gilchrist capt wkt k warne s kasprowicz n gillespie d mcgrath aleem dar r shepherd

documents: england hopeful over jones england are hopeful that simon jones will be fit for the boxing day test against south africa despite going down with stomach bug the glamorgan paceman left friday practice session early to return to the team hotel he got slight bug but he had little bit of bowl and am sure he will be fine for the test captain michael vaughan commented jones took in the first test to help england to sevenwicket victory and coach duncan fletcher hopes he will return to bowling at express pace after lengthy rehabilitation from knee injury jones has bowled with reduced speed since tearing cruciate ligament at the start of the ashes tour now he got this confidence he can probably up the speed little bit fletcher told bbc sport and if he can do that we ve got strong bowling unit there the welshman showed glimpses of his former self during the recent oneday series in zimbabwe there were few balls he got over where he was just trying himself out fletcher continued and if he can get back up there he ll be back to being that shock bowler he hardly played any firstclass cricket he hardly played any games for glamorgan he only played few tests for us should jones fail to recover in time for the second test lancashire james anderson would be the obvious replacement

Label: cricket
documents: union to contest vaughan penalty the hefty fine imposed on england captain michael vaughan during the fourth test against south africa is to be challenged by his players union vaughan lost his match fee of xcxa after referee clive lloyd ruled he was wrong to complain about inconsistent umpiring on the second day the captain felt the umpires erred over whether to play during poor light pca chief executive richard bevan said to impose fine is ridiculous and taken out of all proportion vaughan was charged with breach of level two of the international cricket council code of conduct there are four levels of offences ranging from one to four with four being the most serious only those punished for level three or four offences have the opportunity to contest if they are going to impose the maximum fine they must allow an appeal procedure bevan continued we will be calling the icc and if we don receive some common sense we will consider legal action under european laws vaughan made the comments after umpires steve bucknor and aleem dar ended the second day because of bad light even though vaughan who was at the crease at the time wanted to go on the icc expect players to promote the game and talk to tv and the media and all michael did was answer some questions honestly bevan explained he did not swear or abuse anyone he politely suggested there had been some in consistent umpiring he certainly did not bring cricket into disrepute it strikes me the umpires have had poor test both on and off the field all match bevan was due to meet the ecb on monday to get their backing
