documents: scotland italy six chris paterson penalties gave scotland victory in dour but clinical encounter against italy at murrayfield coach matt williams side were outmuscled and outplayed in tense first half but led at the break paterson slotted four more secondhalf penalties and scotland were denied try when wing sean lamont touchdown was ruled out for forward pass late andrea masi try was small consolation for italy chasing their first away win in the six nations scotland came out on top of the early exchanges and took quick lead through the boot of fullback paterson but the more powerful azzurri pack eventually rumbled into life series of drives into scottish territory set up penalty attempt missed by fullback roland de marigny and wayward dropgoal effort from luciano orquera scotland defended the initial thrusts but on minutes italy after coming up yards short of the line equalised through de marigny penalty italy were offered another penalty when scottish flanker simon taylor was offside but the leftfooted de marigny pushed his kick wide scotland finally made the most of rare foray into the italian half and snatched three points from paterson when an italian forward handled the ball in ruck as the half wore on both sides squandered promising spells of momentum with sloppy penalties and the period fizzled out with scotland numerically if not psychologically on top italy de marigny narrowly missed chance to level the scores again shortly after the break but his longrange kick shaved the right upright and scotland capitalised with third paterson penalty on minutes williams side seemed to have found spark from somewhere and after couple of probing attacks paterson was able to slot another three points to widen the gap with the pendulum of possession swinging towards scotland lamont thought he had wriggled over in the left corner after minutes but play was recalled for marginal forward pass from paterson another paterson penalty on minutes kept the pressure on the wilting visitors but john kirwan men had the last laugh when gordon ross attempted clearance was charged down and masi pounced for the try converted by de marigny paterson webster craig southwell lamont parks cusiter smith bulloch capt kerr grimes murray taylor petrie hogg russell douglas hines dunbar blair ross hinshelwood de marigny mirco bergamasco stoica masi nitoglia documents: prop jones ready for hard graft adam jones says the wales forwards are determined to set the perfect attacking platform for the backs by dominating the powerful france pack in paris the prop said if we get stuffed in the front five our backs have had it the mentality of the french is scrum scrum scrum we will see how good france are and the scrum is the key just hope carry on where they left off against italy it just up to us in the forwards to win the ball and give them the opportunity wales have won two of their last three visits to stade de france having secured backtoback wins under graham henry in and and with the likes of shane williams and gavin henson finding top form at the right time mike ruddock team is now one of international rugby most potent attacking threats gavin is ridiculously talented he has been bouncing around the place this week so he is up for it warned jones france have been criticised for their uncharacteristic onedimensional play in their victories over scotland and france captain fabien pelous has acknowledged his side needs to show more attacking flair but stressed the game with be won or lost up front the lock believes the welsh forwards are not big enough to trouble his side in the scrum or lineout but jones insisted his fellow frontrow colleagues have nothing to fear gethin won be intimidated tomorrow none of us will said jones who will be facing france for the first time we will go out there and front up and hopefully get the ball out to the backs me and gethin are quite young so it is good to have someone of mefin experience in there mefin is good thinker who puts things across but what is the saying if you are good enough you are old enough and gethin certainly is he is really good player and imagine he will be on the lions tour

documents: preview ireland england sun lansdowne road dublin sunday february gmt bbc radio lw and this website ireland are going for their first grand slam since after two opening wins and england represent their sternest test of the championship so far england were sloppy and leaderless in the defeats against wales and france and another loss would be unthinkable the pressure is on coach andy robinson and his side have to deliver despite england dramatic dip in form since the world cup final they have lost eight of their last matches ireland coach eddie sullivan says his side should not underestimate the visitors had they kicked their points they would have beaten france and that would have created different landscape for sunday he said this is england we are talking about they have depth of talent and very good record against ireland they will target victory in dublin as the turning point in their six nations the differences between the sides is also highlighted in the team selections for the dublin encounter ireland despite having gordon arcy still out injured have been boosted by the return of star skipper brian driscoll who missed the scotland game with hamstring injury the knowledge that the england game was coming up really helped during rehabilitation he said the will to play in this game was enormous it doesn get much bigger than england at home as well as entering the tournament without players like jonny wilkinson mike tindall and richard hill england have now lost two tighthead props in julian white and phil vickery while blindside flanker lewis moody is major concern robinson who received lot of flak for the inclusion and then dropping of centre mathew tait has kept faith with kicking flyhalf charlie hodgson despite his horror show at twickenham if england slump in dublin it will be their worst run of results in the championship since but robinson was bullish during the week about the game saying that his side are going there to documents: ireland argentina an injurytime dropped goal by ronan gara stole victory for ireland from underneath the noses of argentina at lansdowne road on saturday gara kicked all of ireland points with two dropped goals and five penalties to give the home side record in their autumn internationals an impressive argentina appeared in control until the dying seconds the pumas shocked the irish early on with try from federico aramburu and felipe contepomi kicked points the welldrilled and sharper pumas outplayed and outthought ireland in the early stages indiscipline allowed argentina leinster flyhalf contepomi to open the scoring in the third minute with straightforward penalty he was on the mark again two minutes later when argentina shocked ragged ireland with the first try of the game ireland turned the ball over and manuel contepomi broke through an unstructured defence before feeding his midfield partner aramburu to sprint in under the posts gara finally got ireland on the board with dropped goal in the ninth minute only for contepomi to rifle over his second penalty two minutes later playing into strong wind and rain ireland continued to come second best in tight situations and turnovers began to mount up against rugged defence gara managed to land his second penalty in the th minute but once again contepomi replied in kind four minutes into firsthalf injury time the secondhalf started as the first had ended gara rifled over another penalty in the th minute but contepomi matched it three minutes later the upperbody strength of the pumas never allowed ireland to take control up front while the threequarters had no space to manoeuvre ireland had to rely on gara boot to keep in touch rather than any contrived running plays the munsterman landed two more penalties one of them from metres to bring his team to within four points with minutes on the clock remaining and ireland chance came when argentina number eight gonzalo longo was yellow carded with six minutes to go for an offence in the lineout gara made no mistake as he rifled over his fifth penalty to set up tense final few minutes but ireland showed great composure to get themselves into position to allow gara to thump over massive drop goal to complete tremendous if fortuitous comeback

documents: lomu relishing return to action former all black star jonah lomu says he cannot wait to run out on the pitch for former england rugby union captain martin johnson testimonial on june the yearold had kidney transplant in july but will play his first full match for three years leading southern hemisphere side at twickenham actually started training three weeks after my operation but was very limited until few months ago now it basically bring it on said the giant winger the match on june will be my first man game but have training schedule which is quite testing and combines with sevens and whole lot of things said lomu have got so much energy since my operation that train three times day six days week mohammed ali has always been my ideal coming back to rugby people said you are dreaming but it always starts off with dream it up to you whether you want to make it reality opinion has been divided on whether lomu should attempt to return to the game after such major operation but when lomu was asked whether he was taking risk he replied as much as someone going down the road being hit by bus there are lot of people in the world with one kidney who just don know it have talked this over had chat with the donor and this is to set my soul at peace and finish something started in at his lowest ebb lomu was so ill he could barely walk but he says he is now getting stronger every day and his longterm target is to play for new zealand again the only person who saw me at my worst was my wife he added used to take two steps and fall over but now can run and it is all coming back and lot more quickly than ever thought it would to play for the all blacks would be the highest honour could get that is the longterm goal and you have to start somewhere

documents: a year to remember for irish there used to be one subliminal moment during year in irish rugby that stood out more than most well at least there used to one now there is handful to look back with mixture of satisfaction and sorrow it has been quite year for the irish and not just with eddie sullivan triple crown winning international outfit either right down through the ranks irish rugby is creating waves and upsetting the more established teams in the game but most of the kudos will go to sullivan and his merry band of warriors who not only collected their first triple crown for years but also finished their autumn campaign with record for the second year in succession they also finished in the runnersup spot in the rbs six nations but in the three games in november which included victory over trinations champions and grand slam chasing south africa ireland finsihed the year on high the victory at lansdowne road was only their second victory over the boks after the initial success back in that success was revenge for the consecutive defeats in blomefontein and cape town in the summer those two reverses and the flop against france were the only dark patches in an otherwise excellent months but the big one of course was the defeat of world cup champions england on their precious twickenham turf the winning try was conceived in sullivan mind perfectly executed by the team and finished immaculately by girvan dempsey for me the try of the championship sullivan career is now in vertical takeoff mode it is no wonder that sir clive woodward has elevated the galwaybased coach to head the lions test side not only that but fair majority of the present ireland side will be wearing red next june in new zealand there can be no doubt that ireland representation will be the biggest ever albeit in proposed man squad in brian driscoll and paul connell ireland have now the two frontrunners for the captaincy gordon arcy whose career began as teenager back in finally arrived when he was named the six nations player of the tournament but it was not only the senior squad that brought kudos to ireland the youngsters strutted their stuff on the big stage as well the under squad confounded the doubters as they went all the way to the world cup final in scotland only to be beaten by powerful all black side in the decider the young irish boys had stated their intentions earlier in the season when they finished runnersup to england in the six nations under tournament on the provincial front leinster for second year in succession blew it when the heineken cup looked good wager while ulster finished runnersup in their very tight group for the second season in succession it was munster again flying the flag for the irish looking to reach their third final they went down to eventual winners wasps in what many beileve was the most competitive and thunderous game ever witnessed at lansdowne road how wasps recovered from that energysapping duel and then go onto to defeat toulouse in the final was anybody guess ulster meanwhile just lost out to adding the inaugural celtic cup in winning the celtic league when they were pipped at the post by the scarlets in the final game ulster however took time to start the new season under new coach mark mccall the once famous ravenhill fortress was breached four times as ulster only manged five wins from their first outings in the celtic league leinster are again looking the most potent outfit going into but whether they can take that final step under declan kidney is another thing on the down side irish rugby was hit by number of tragedies teenage star john mccall died while playing for the ireland against new zealand in the under world cup game in durban that happened only days after he led royal armagh to their first ulster schools cup success since the death of former ireland coach and lions flanker mike doyle in car crash in northern ireland shocked the rugby fraternity larger than life character doyle had coached ireland to the triple crown in the last time that goal had been achieved before this season ulster rugby also suffered the sudden deaths of wellknown londonderry ym player jim huey coleraine jonathan hutchinson and belfast harlequins lock johnny poole they all passed away long before the fulltime whistle

Label: rugby
documents: paris promise raises welsh hopes has there been better six nations match than saturday epic in paris and can the welsh revival continue all the way to first grand slam since those are the two questions occupying not just wales supporters but rugby fans as whole after scintillating display in paris welsh legend mervyn davies member of two of three grand slamwinning sides of the hailed it as one of the great performances of the past three decades martyn williams wales twotry scorer on the day called it one of the most surreal games have ever played in crestfallen france coach bernard laporte simply observed there was french half and there was welsh half and what half it was for the red dragonhood transforming halftime deficit into an lead within five mesmerising minutes of the second period but while that passage of play showed the swelling selfbelief of side prepared to back its own spirit of adventure the final quarter told us whole lot more about this welsh side that they recovered from battering in the first halfhour to first stem the tide before halftime then reverse it on the resumption was remarkable enough but in resisting seemingly unstoppable wave of french pressure in nailbiting final five minutes wales showed not only their physical attributes but their mental resolve in international rugby any of the top seven sides can beat each other on given day but the great sides are those that win the close contests on consistent basis england suffered some infamous six nations disappointments en route to world cup glory the pain of defeat forging bonds that ultimately led to victory when it really mattered wales have some way to go before they can be remotely considered in similar light but the signs are that players previously on the receiving end are learning how to emerge on the right side of the scoreline ten of the on duty on saturday were also involved when wales were trounced in paris two years ago but since they threw off the shackles against new zealand in the world cup wales have rediscovered much of what made them great rugby nation in the first place the confidence in the squad has been building and building since the world cup and we now have young players who are becoming world class noted coach mike ruddock the likes of michael owen gethin jenkins dwayne peel and gavin henson are certainly building strong cases for inclusion on this summer lions tour to new zealand and players like stephen jones martyn williams shane williams and gareth thomas are proving it is not only the youngsters that are on an upward curve jones after his superb manofthematch display observed that we are very happy camp now ruddock and thomas can take much of the credit for that ensuring the tribal and regional divisions that have often scarred welsh rugby do not extend to the national squad the joie de vivre so evident in that magical secondhalf spell in paris also stems from style of play that first wooed supporters the world over in the if england had half the innate attacking exuberance wales have produced in this championship they would not be contemplating the debris of three consecutive defeats similarly wales have learnt that style alone does not win matches and that forward power mental toughness and good decisionmaking under pressure are equally important so on to murrayfield where wales have not won on their last three visits while the hype in the principality will go into overdrive the players will set about the task of beating scotland only then with the visit of ireland to finish can they start thinking about emulating the hallowed players of the and writing their own names into welsh legend

documents: connell rejects lions rumours ireland and munster lock paul connell has dismissed media reports linking him to the captaincy of the lions tour to new zealand this summer connell is rumoured to be among the frontrunners for the job but says he is totally focused on sunday six nations crunch clash with england honestly don think about these reports he told bbc sport the lions thing is all speculation and newspaper talk nothing more just ignore it and get on with my job he added the only thing that annoys me after reading some reports is what the opposition locks think can just imagine them saying m going to show this guy what what about second row play that the one thing that makes me cringe connell who made tryscoring international debut against wales two years ago is enjoying his meteoric rise into rugby shop window but refuses to be drawn on the lions have spoken to sir clive woodward few times but not for very long certainly nothing about summer holidays he joked he also said he remains wary of wounded england abilities coming into sunday game after two straight defeats dismissing predictions of certain irish victory it very dangerous to think that this england team has so much experience and skill you do not become bad team overnight they have two world class gamebreakers in josh lewsey and jason robinson while charlie hodgson is just ready to click into place he insisted ireland will not make the mistake of being overconfident that not going to happen in our squad no ireland team lining up to play england will ever fall into that trap he said every time we play england we know what big task it is look at what they did to us two years ago remember that game all too well and it was not good feeling came on as replacement and we were losing and ended up getting hammered so know what can happen when england come to dublin they could so easily have been coming to dublin with two wins and staring grand slam in the face as well

documents: wales silent on grand slam talk rhys williams says wales are still not thinking of winning the grand slam despite third six nations win that the last thing on our minds at the moment said williams second half replacement in saturday win over france in paris we all realise how difficult task it is to go up to scotland and beat them we ve come unstuck there couple of times recently so our focus is on that game and we ll worry about ireland hopefully after we ve beaten scotland with captain gareth thomas ruled out of the rest of the campaign with broken thumb williams is vying for his first start in the championship so far kevin morgan is probably favourite to replace thomas at fullback leaving williams and hal luscombe to battle for the right wing berth hamstring injury denied luscombe the opportunity to make third successive start but the dragons winger is expected to be fit for the trip to murrayfield on march hooker robin mcbryde is doubtful after picking up knee injury in paris but centre sonny parker and flanker colin charvis are set to recover from injury to be in contention for selection said wales assistant coach scott johnson they ve worked through the weekend and the reports are bit more positive so we re getting couple back and that adds to the depth of the squad scotland secured their first win of the campaign on saturday by grinding out an win over italy matt williams side has shown little in attack but johnson insisted the scots will be difficult opposition to break down italy are really brave opposition and sometimes it very hard to win he said so an ugly win can be just as effective as or point victory scotland are hard side and very underrated so we re not taking anything for granted we re not basking in the glory of winning our first three games we ve got to be diligent in our preparation that my job and we ve got to make sure we re focused

documents: robinson answers critics england captain jason robinson has rubbished suggestions that the world champions are team in decline england were beaten by wales in their six nations opener in cardiff last week and face current champions france at twickenham on sunday robinson said we are certainly not on the decline you lose one game and it doesn make you bad team have no doubt in the players we ve got we have still got the team to go out and beat anyone on our day england find themselves striving to avoid third successive championship defeat for the first time since but fullback robinson believes the newlook england team can stop the rot against france last weekend we should have won the game he said but if we can underperform and lose by only two points then am sure if we play well this week we will get the win we need we proved that in the autumn when we put in some excellent performances and we just need to build on that it was disappointing start against wales and we might be down on that but we are certainly not out we will come out fighting this week robinson also had words of comfort for yearold newcastle centre mathew tait who made his international debut against wales but has been demoted from the squad to face france have had word with mathew said robinson still believe in him he is an outstanding player but we have gone for olly barkley because of the kicking mathew has just got to take it on the chin keep working hard like he is doing and m sure he will feature in some of the games

documents: castaignede fires laporte warning former france flyhalf thomas castaignede has warned the pressure is mounting on coach bernard laporte following their defeat by wales france suffered shock loss against the welsh at the weekend after looking on course for an easy win castaignede told bbc sport the pressure is big on laporte after huge loss to new zealand slim win over scotland and miracle against england but the french have to get behind him and the team at lansdowne road following victories over south africa and australia in november france were deemed by many to be the world leading side but they were then trounced by new zealand and only just beat scotland after the scots had try disallowed in their six nations opener it then took some woeful spot kicking from charlie hodgson and olly barkley to help them to victory against england at twickenham lt castaignede said you can say any of those results have eased the pressure on laporte had england kickers not been so bad the position in the six nations would be very different now laporte has been criticised for france negative tactics in their wins over scotland and england but his side played more freeflowing style against wales making mockery of the opposition defence in the first half before suffering shock turnaround in fortunes after the interval all the chat in france has been about how france will play against ireland said castaignede ahead of the march tie everyone wants to see the sort of play we saw against wales but everyone also wants win castaignede veteran of international caps admitted the french would go in as underdogs against ireland going to ireland is never easy but the way they re playing right now it harder than ever said castaignede they re very experienced and don often lose at home they ve got some great forwards and some electric runners on the break despite praising the irish he claimed the welsh had the upper hand in the six nations runin ireland have such good pack but wales are something else on the break he added at the weekend they were simply awesome as frenchman it was disappointing to see but you had to admire it their commitment to every cause can make them win this championship the yearold also tipped yann delaigue to start ahead of frederic michalak at number after an impressive display in paris last weekend delaigue played really well and admittedly michalak played well too said castaignede m just glad m not the one who has to make the decision

documents: calder fears for scottish rugby former scotland international finlay calder fears civil war at the sru could seriously hamper his country rbs six nations campaign four members of the executive board including the chairman david mackay have resigned after simmering row and calder said this is terrible news for every level of scottish rugby david is successful businessman and thought that if anybody could transform the negative atmosphere and rising debt level it was him mackay executive board has been in power struggle with the general committee which contains members elected by scotland club sides he has been driven out by people who seem happier waging civil war than addressing the central issue that professional rugby can be run by amateurs said calder in fact don understand why we are still having this argument years after professionalism arrived but don believe the rest of the sru will take this lying down think the banks will be dismayed at this decision and ultimately it is them who pull the strings so wouldn be surprised if they reviewed their position but in the wider picture what message does this send out he thought the work of scotland coaches who have been attempting to arrest the decline of the national side would be made much more difficult matt williams and willie anderson must be wondering what have we walked into here said calder and we can now expect weeks of arguments and acrimony just at time when we should be looking forward to the six nations championship am very very disappointed more than you can imagine why do so many scots have this knack of turning on each other when the going gets tough

documents: ireland south africa ronan gara scored all ireland points as the home side claimed only their second ever win over south africa on an emotional day at lansdowne road gara firsthalf try poached after quick tappenalty helped the irish to lead at halftime three further gara penalties extended ireland lead to as the game entered the final quarter two percy montgomery penalties set up frantic finish but ireland held out to claim famous victory ireland began strongly and were never led but the match was tense and closely fought throughout aware of the threat posed by the south africans ireland pressed hard from the outset and played some impressive rugby while searching for breakthrough early on denis hickie thought he was in for try after delightful backline move but shane horgan pass was adjudged to have gone forward by referee paul honiss ireland continued to press and they showed their intent by opting for lineout in the th minute when three straightforward points were on offer another south african infringement minute later led to ireland first points gara took quick tappenalty and charged over the opposition line for an irish try the springboks could feel hard done by as captain john smit had his back to the play when gara pounced after referee honiss had told the skipper to warn his own players after consistent infringements stung by the score the south africans almost replied with try of their own within seconds with geordan murphy ankletap tackle denying certain try for percy montgomery however the springboks did win penalty minute later which montgomery easily slotted to cut ireland lead to ireland got out of jail when the south africans had threetoone overlap near the irish line only to waste the chance after the sustained springboks pressure the irish produced an attack of their own in the th minute which culminated with gara clever dropgoal to restore his side lead to five points which remained the margin at halftime sustained irish pressure immediately after halftime was rewarded by another gara penalty however montgomery responded quickly by slotting over superb penalty from near the right touchline to cut ireland lead to five points again montgomery then burst through the irish defence in the th minute and it took superb girvan dempsey tackle to prevent try the south africans suffered doubleblow in the nd minute when schalk burger was sinbinned for the second week in row after killing the ball and gara punished the transgression by notching another penalty in the st minute hickie was left frustrated by poor pass from girvan dempsey as chance to seal the match was wasted however late tackle on brian driscoll enabled gara to notch another penalty in the rd minute which extended ireland lead to however two montgomery penalties had ireland lead in peril again as the springboks closed to within five points with seven minutes remaining south africa produced huge effort in the closing minutes but ireland held on to claim deserved victory dempsey murphy o driscoll capt horgan hickie o gara stringer corrigan byrne hayes o kelly o connell easterby o connor foley sheahan horan o callaghan miller easterby humphreys maggs montgomery paulse joubert de wet barry willemse van der westhuyzen du preez du randt smit captain andrews botha matfield burger aj venter van niekerk shimange cj van der linde britz rossouw claassens de villiers du toitj fourie paul honiss new zealand

documents: wilkinson to lead england flyhalf jonny wilkinson has been named as england new rugby union captain for the three november tests the yearold newcastle star takes over from lawrence dallaglio who retired from internationals in august england acting head coach andy robinson said he is natural leader holds the respect of the squad and is formidable talent on the pitch and he consistently demonstrates the energy and commitment feel is essential to be captain of england robinson added there are several players in the squad would feel comfortable in calling upon to be england captain but for me jonny is in every way the right player to take on this challenge captaincy offers challenging environment for any player especially following in the footsteps of lawrence dallaglio and before him the world cup captain martin johnson but am confident jonny has what it takes to do an outstanding job as we look ahead towards the next rugby world cup in france and look forward to working with him wilkinson who has scored points in internationals kicked the winning dropgoal in the final seconds of extratime in england rugby world cup triumph against australia but he then missed the entire six nations campaign while recuperating from shoulder surgery before making his comeback for newcastle in the zurich premiership in august it the ambition of so many players to one day be captain of england and today have realised dream he said m honoured andy wants me to be his captain and to follow lawrence and martin means lot to me as they are inspirational men who have given so much to england rugby over many years getting my first england cap against ireland six years ago was something ll never forget because to play for your country is very special taking on the captaincy is another important step in my career and do so with immense pride wilkinson made his international debut in the six nations championship against ireland when he came off the bench to replace paul grayson he has been regular in the england starting lineup ever since played in all three lions tests in and all but one of england games in the world cup he becomes the th captain of england since fred stokes held the position in england first autumn test is against canada on november followed by the visit of trinations champions south africa week later and then world cup rematch with australia

documents: johnson announces june retirement former england captain martin johnson has announced he is to retire from rugby union at the end of the season johnson who captained england to world cup glory in will play his final match in june johnson won england caps and quit test rugby at the start of just two months after leading sir clive woodward team to victory in sydney the yearold leicester lock final match will be his testimonial at twickenham on june m confident have made the right decision to retire said johnson m sure there will be times next season when ll wish was out there playing for the tigers but you know when the time is right to go and feel this is the right time feel physically that could play for another season but playing week in and week out in the premiership is fulltime occupation and only want to be out there for the right reasons johnson will always be revered by england fans for captaining england to their dramatic world cup win against australia in sydney but his list of achievements does not stop at that he is the only man to captain the lions twice and he also led england to six nations grand slam johnson also had huge success as captain of leicester guiding the tigers to back to back heineken cup victories and several premiership titles apart from his marvellous captaincy johnson was also one of the finest second rows to ever play the game teak tough and physically intimidating he ruled the rucks and mauls for the best part of decade and was integral in england rise to the top of the world game his final appearance will be in his testimonial at twickenham where he will lead team against side captained by new zealand winger jonah lomu the all black is aiming to return to action after kidney transplant and johnson expects it to be memorable occasion this game against jonah will be great way to end the season and end my career said johnson lomu rugby union first global superstar after his exploits in the world cup said he was proud to be part of johnson farewell we hold him in such high esteem said lomu he is such great leader and am just honoured to be on the same pitch

documents: ireland england ireland consigned england to their third straight six nations defeat with stirring victory at lansdowne road secondhalf try from captain brian driscoll and points from ronan gara kept ireland on track for their first grand slam since england scored first through martin corry but had tries from mark cueto and josh lewsey disallowed andy robinson men have now lost nine of their last matches since the world cup final the defeat also heralded england worst run in the championship since ireland last won the title then the five nations in but years on they share top spot in the table on maximum points with wales and eddie sullivan side banished the ghosts of when england were rampant victors in claiming the grand slam at lansdowne road in front of supercharged home crowd on dry but blustery day in dublin ireland tore into the whiteshirted visitors from the kickoff and made their intentions clear when gara landed fourthminute dropgoal england took their time to settle but their first real venture into ireland half produced simple score for corry the number eight picked up the ball from the back of ruck and found an absence of green jerseys between himself and the irish line racing yards to touch down england flyhalf charlie hodgson nailed the conversion from out on the left but almost immediately gara winning his th cap answered with two penalties in quick succession england were awarded penalty of their own on the halfway line after minutes and hodgson the villain at twickenham coolly bisected the posts the first quarter was marked by periods of tactical kicking but it was ireland who were showing more willingness to spread the ball wide to their eager and inventive backs series of probes led by the talismanic driscoll back from hamstring injury resulted in penalty but ireland chose to kick for touch from the lineout the ball was recycled back to gara who stroked his second dropgoal this time off the right upright as the interval approached wing josh lewsey was the catalyst for england most promising attack the wasps star raced up his touchline and hodgson crosskick put in mark cueto for an apparent score but the sale wing was ruled to have started in front of the kicker england began the second half well and had ireland pinned in their own half but another english indiscretion on rare irish breakout awarded gara kick at goal which he missed england pressure continued and wave of attacks saw centre jamie noon dragged down yards from the line before hodgson landed dropgoal the lead was shortlived however ireland raced upfield deft handling from the backs including clever dummy from geordan murphy on hodgson ending with driscoll going over in the right corner and touching down close to the posts gara missed penalty which would have put ireland nine points clear and the home crowd breathed sigh of relief when hodgson crosskick was fumbled by lock ben kay near the line anticipation of home win sent the noise level skyhigh but gara missed another chance to seal the game with wayward dropgoal attempt inside the last minutes england poured forward spurred on by scrumhalf matt dawson who replaced leicester harry ellis but despite one near miss with the pack over the line not checked on the tv replay by referee jonathan kaplan england were unable to pull off facesaving win ireland next face france at lansdowne road in two weeks time before the potential title decider against wales in cardiff england are still to meet italy at twickenham in what is now wooden spoon decider and scotland murphy dempsey o driscoll horgan hickie o gara stringer corrigan byrne hayes o kelly o connell easterby o connor foley sheahan horan o callaghan miller easterby humphreys maggs robinson capt cueto noon barkley lewsey hodgson ellis rowntree thompson stevens grewcock kay worsley moody corry titterrell bell borthwick hazell dawson goode smith

documents: bortolami predicts dour contest italy skipper marco bortolami believes saturday six nations contest against scotland will be scrappy encounter with both sides looking for their first win of the championship the thirdround game at murrayfield has been billed as woodenspoon decider and bortolami feels the edinburgh contest could end up being bruising battle of the packs it will not be pretty game because both teams are desperate to gain their first win said the lock forward italy have only recorded three wins since they joined the six nations in but two of those have come against scotland this year italy opened up with stubborn display against ireland but ended up losing however they were thoroughly outplayed by an impressive welsh side in rome last time out now the italians travel to edinburgh hoping to claim their first away win in the six nations scotland played extremely well against france in paris but not so well when ireland came to edinburgh said bortolami we are still very disappointed with our last game against wales in rome and we are thoroughly determined to right the wrongs as nation our quest is to be respected as team worthy of place in this tournament and we can only do this by winning games

Label: rugby
documents: november to remember last saturday one newspaper proclaimed that england were still the number one side in the world that statement was made to look little foolish by events later that afternoon at twickenham but it illustrated the wonderful unpredictability of test rugby at the highest level at the end of richly entertaining autumn series the final weekend threw the world pecking order into renewed confusion with australia triumph in london followed by france capitulation to new zealand clearly there is no number one side in the world at the moment declared wallabies coach eddie jones on arrival back in sydney there are four five or probably six sides all competing at the same level and on any given day the difference between one side and another is only about while that bodes well for rugby as whole it also sharpens the sense of excitement ahead of what could be the most open six nations championship for decade while the wallabies all blacks and springboks hit the beach before turning their attention to super matters in the new year europe finest have less than weeks before they return to the international fray and for the first time in more than decade it will not simply be straightforward choice between england and france for the six nations title that owes much to ireland continued progress and the belief that wales are on the verge of delivering major scalp to cement the promise of their autumn displays who secured first triple crown in years last season could go one better and win their first fivesix nations title since they start with away games against italy and scotland before england and france come to lansdowne road their momentous victory over the springboks can only bolster ireland selfbelief while ronan gara late drop goal to deliver victory over argentina was further proof that eddie sullivan side can now close out tight games not that england or france who have won nine of the last six nations titles between them will lay down quietly dismantling of the springboks suggested that even after the loss of such influential figures as martin johnson and lawrence dallaglio they still have the personnel to prosper the narrow defeat to australia was timely reminder that not everything is blooming in the red rose garden but the fresh shoots of postworld cup recovery have been sown by new head coach andy robinson fresh desire to regain former heights is evident and if england emerge triumphant from an opening six nations engagement in cardiff fourth title in six years is within reach are in familiar revival territory but this time it appears there is substance behind the rediscovered style while south africa overconfidence in cardiff made for closer scoreline than expected wales could legitimately claim to have had victory within their grasp against the all blacks in one of the best tests in recent memory if mike ruddock can coax reliable setpiece platform from his pack there is no reason why victories should not ensue come february the last fortnight has left in state of bewilderment after an autumn series that began with superb victory over australia stunning defeat to argentina their first loss since the world cup could have been attributed to trademark french inconsistency but the manner of new zealand demolition job in paris has coach bernard laporte bemoaning lack of young talent coming through to replace the old guard fortunately for the french the opening match of the six nations sees them entertaining in paris after two reasonable performances against australia the scots humbling by the springboks forced coach matt williams to reassess his belief that win over one of the major nations was imminent while individuals such as chris cusiter and ali hogg enhanced their reputations lack of topclass players will continue to undermine their best efforts who start with home games against ireland and wales before travelling to scotland are also hopeful of registering more than one victory for the first time in the championship as autumn gives way to winter and the heineken cup prepares to resume centre stage meantime the joy of six will keep the home fires burning until february

documents: hong kong in world cup bid hong kong is hoping to join japan as cohost of the rugby world cup japan has applied to host the tournament on its own with the aim of taking it outside rugby traditional strongholds for the first time but hong kong rugby football union hkrfu chairman john molloy has called for the territory to host one of the pools and quarterfinal the japanese rugby football union jrfu says it has yet to receive formal presentation from the hkrfu at this stage we are only considering hosting the event by ourselves said jrfu secretary koji tokumasu we cannot examine any proposal unless we get it in definitive form japan faces stiff competition in the form of south africa and new zealand to host the event in seven years time until now the world cup has been held in countries from the six nations or trinations said tokumasu we think and the irb thinks that it is time for rugby to go global japan is ready to host the tournament and we are looking forward to welcoming the world of rugby to japan tokumasu added that the football world cup cohosted by japan and south korea had been huge success as well as having the infrastructure in place japan also has the commercial clout to host one of sport top competitions he said last year japan launched its first professional rugby league and it has the fourth largest number of registered players in the world after england south africa and france

documents: hodges announces rugby retirement scarlets and usa eagles forward dave hodges has ended his playing career to pursue coaching role in the states the yearold who has caps was llanelli player of the season in but has battled injury for the last two of his seven years at stradey he tore pectoral muscle against the ospreys on boxing day an injury that would have kept him out for the season realising would be unable to play this season the club and agreed to end my contract early said hodges it allows me to move back to the us and pursue opportunities there and allows the scarlets to look to the next generation the scarlets have begun to rebuild their squad for next season after disappointing heineken cup campaign with plenty more signings and departures expected in the coming weeks scarlets chief executive stuart gallacher confirmed that of the current squad would be out of contract in the summer we have deliberate policy whereby around half the squad are coming out of contract and they know they won all be resigned it a chance to invigorate the squad he said m positive about the future of the scarlets both on and off the field gallacher was keen to pay tribute to the role backfive forward hodges has played at stradey park though david has been highly influential member of our squad for seven years said gallacher he is real professional and we thank him for the part he has played in our success am sure he has an enormous contribution to make to the development of rugby in the us and we wish him and his family well hodges described his years at stradey as the best time of my life

had been impressed by current flyhalf yann delaigue in the rbs six nations to date but he told bbc sport michalak is the answer both now and for the future delaigue deserved his chance but the time has come to bring back michalak he does have weaknesses but has the allround game to upset ireland the yearold michalak has spent much of the tournament on the bench after delaigue impressed for castres early in the season with michalak overlooked the french stuttered to narrow wins over scotland and then england before ironically playing their best rugby in the defeat to wales the wales game was amazing to watch but never did think the french could lose that game at halftime said sella their only mistakes were that they didn score enough points in the first half and were little bit less focused in the second but only little bit sella however insisted the pressure had eased on the underfire laporte despite the defeat at the stade de france this season is very important for shaping team for the world cup said sella which laporte is doing very well the french get better every game it difficult though when you change team and you change your tactics as everything has to gel but he has the players and the talent to take them all the way to world cup victory as result it is important that people give him time it may not seem good now that we re not winning the grand slam but no one will care in two years time if we re world champions the majority of media criticism centred on the way in which france produced performance devoid of running rugby in their opening two games but documents: celts savour grand slam prospect the six nations has heralded new order in northern hemisphere rugby this year and wales and ireland rather than traditional big guns france and england face potential grand slam playoff in three weeks time but before that game in cardiff wales must get past scotland at murrayfield while ireland face the not insignificant task of home fixture with the mercurial french noone knows what mood france will be in at lansdowne road on march sublime as in the first half against wales or ridiculous like in the same period against england at twickenham but how the mighty have fallen england sat on rugby summit months ago as world champions and grand slam winners but they have lost nine of their matches since that heady night in sydney and they face the ignominy of what could amount to wooden spoon playoff against italy in fortnight england are enduring their worst run in the championship since captain richard hill was dumped in favour of mike harrison after three straight losses in coach andy robinson who took over from the successful sir clive woodward in september has lost phalanx of world cup stars and he is enduring the toughest of teething problems in bedding down his own style with new team the same year that england ruled the roost woeful wales lost all five matches in the six nations and they won only two games against scotland and italy in wales most recent championship title was in and their last grand slam success came in in the era of gareth edwards phil bennett jpr williams et al but welsh rugby fans remain on permanent tenterhooks for the blossoming of new golden age after several false dawns coach mike ruddock may have come up with the team and philosophy to match expectations the fresh verve is inspired by skipper gareth thomas now out with broken thumb accurate kicking from either flyhalf stephen jones or centre gavin henson rampant martyn williams leading the way up front and exciting runners in the guise of henson and shane williams ireland coach eddie sullivan and captain brian driscoll have got their side buzzing too and they are close to shedding the nearlymen tag that has dogged them for the past few years the men from the emerald isle have been six nations runnersup for the past two years to france and england but they have not won the title since and last clinched grand slam in as for scotland they have struggled this decade and the wooden spoon winners have not been in the top two since they lifted the title in italy continue the elusive search for their first six nations away win and can still only account for the scalps of scotland twice and wales since joining the elite in coach john kirwan is passionate and dedicated believer in the azzurri but is lacking in raw materials and so to france brilliant one minute inept the next but the reigning champions could quite easily turn on the style in dublin and end up winning the title through the back door ireland though have won three times in their last five meetings welsh romantics would probably prefer glorious victory in the celtic showdown to crown their grand slam but given that ireland have beaten wales in four of their last five meetings the welsh legions are likely to be behind les bleus on march

documents: tigers wary of farrell gamble leicester say they will not be rushed into making bid for andy farrell should the great britain rugby league captain decide to switch codes we and anybody else involved in the process are still some way away from going to the next stage tigers boss john wells told bbc radio leicester at the moment there are still lot of unknowns about andy farrell not least his medical situation whoever does take him on is going to take big big gamble farrell who has had persistent knee problems had an operation on his knee five weeks ago and is expected to be out for another three months leicester and saracens are believed to head the list of rugby union clubs interested in signing farrell if he decides to move to the man game if he does move across to union wells believes he would better off playing in the backs at least initially m sure he could make the step between league and union by being involved in the centre said wells think england would prefer him to progress to position in the back row where they can make use of some of his rugby league skills within the forwards the jury is out on whether he can cross that divide at this club the balance will have to be struck between the cost of that gamble and the option of bringing in readymade replacement

Label: rugby
documents: ireland win eclipses refereeing errors the international rugby board may have to step in to stop frustrated coaches and players from publicly haranguing referees when things go bellyup it may have to go the whole way and have nflstyle video cameras all over the field or slap the vociferous perpetrators over the knuckles what the irb does not want is football scenario where the verbal slanging matches often overshadow the game itself sunday explosive six nations clash at lansdowne road was good example as ireland took another step towards their first grand slam since the game was as exciting as it comes with muchimproved england side enraged at few decisions that did not go their way one can understand that frustration there was no doubt that ireland had the rub of the green in their victory but the reaction from the england camp may not have endeared them to the sport blazers referee jonathan kaplan was not perfect by any means and two decisions in particular made him the villain of the piece doubt whether kaplan would have been too pleased at the comments made after all he has no public recourse to criticism it was the same for simon mcdowell the touch judge who was heavily criticised by scotland coach matt williams after their defeat against france as far as england were concerned there were queries over mark cueto first halfeffort when he went over in the corner from charlie hodgson kick england coach andy robinson referred to similar case at ravenhill in january when ulster were playing gloucester in the heineken cup on that occasion david humphreys kicked to tommy bowe who touched down in the corner only for the try to be wiped out but you cannot have cameras at every conceivable angle to pick up such anomalies perhaps robinson was right to say the referee should have gone upstairs when josh lewsey was driven over the irish line near the end lewsey claims he touched it down and was in full control however one has to credit ireland flanker johnny connor for cleverly scooping the ball away and blocking any evidence of touchdown but in rugby everything tends to even out over the minutes the referee also missed england danny grewcock taking out ronan gara off the ball to allow martin corry sunday stroll to the line those were the standout moments in classic game between the two old foes but there were many more and one should not take away from those brian driscoll winning try was as wellconceived as they come while charlie hodgson brilliant kicking display was another highlight and ronan gara tremendous ability to control the game was also crucial component but the defining moments came with ireland under the cosh in the final minutes two outstanding pieces of defensive play denied england and allowed ireland to hold on the first was denis hickie brilliant double tackle in the righthand corner he gobbled up cueto from another hodgson crossfield kick then regained his feet to stop lewsey from scoring certain try ireland secondrow colossus paul connell was equally superb england had turned ireland one way then the other and the defence cordon was slowly disintegrating england prop matt stevens ran in at full steam to suck in few more tacklers unfortunately he ran into connell who hit him hard very hard and then wrestled the ball away for crucial turnover that spoke volumes about ireland backfoot display with defensive coach mike ford taking bow at the end to win game like that showed that ireland have moved forward it may be tries that win games but it is defence that wins championships

documents: umaga ready for lions all blacks captain tama umaga has warned the british and irish lions will be his most fearsome opponents yet ahead of their summer tour but umaga in england for saturday irb rugby aid match also backed new zealand to win the threetest series against the lions he told bbc sport it potentially the most fearsome lineup ve ever come up against they re awesome but d back us all the way to beat them when they come over lions boss sir clive woodward is set to announce his squad for the junejuly tour next month when woodward was appointed last year it was widely believed he would rely heavily on his former england players but umaga said he be hard pushed to do that now considering the shape of the six nations don get me wrong england have got lot of talented guys and m sure there are some of them who ll make the lions test xv but you can disguise wales and ireland in particular some of the tries they ve scored have been great ll admit it ll be fairly awesome lining up against the likes of brian driscoll umaga will meet driscoll in saturday rugby aid match at twickenham with the irish captain leading the northern hemisphere side driscoll is among host of players in the northern hemisphere squad coached by woodward that are tipped for lions callups it ll be good for us to get an early idea of some of these guys although lot can change between now and june umaga said the yearold admitted interest in the lions tour was immense calling it the biggest thing to hit new zealand since lord of the rings he added as players it enough for us to be driven by the rarity of playing the lions in fact it not just us all blacks it the talk of the country umaga admitted the fear of injury weighed on his mind ahead of saturday charity game which features host of big names including george gregan andrew mehrtens and chris latham but he admitted the value of the cause proceeds of the match will go to aiding victims of the tsunami easily won him over the second rod macqueen made the approach didn hesitate it was great when new zealand rugby then gave me the all clear thankfully didn know anyone that was involved in the tragedy of the tsunami but you couldn miss all the horrific reports on the news there are so many people that were affected are still affected and will be affected for long time it just good to know we can do something minor to help out the match will be televised on bbc one at gmt on saturday

documents: funding cut hits wales students the wales students rugby side has become casualty of the welsh rugby union reorganisation at youth level an amalgamated under side formed from separate schools and national youth teams plays its first match on thursday against italy at the gnoll but that move has seen the wru decide to end its funding of representative sides such as wales students as result traditional international fixtures against england and france in the new year have been cancelled the welsh students rugby football union feels that it is unable to properly prepare for or stage the matches the secretary of the welsh students rugby football union reverend eldon phillips said it is shame that fixtures cannot be maintained this year the competition provided by the strong english and french teams has enabled the welsh students to test themselves in high quality matches the increasing number of young rugby players entering higher education look for the biggest challenge that is representative rugby but this year that opportunity will be denied them players who have played for wales students before going on to win full senior representative honours include robert jones rob howley jon humphreys darren morris martyn williams and ceri sweeney

documents: dallaglio his own man to the end controversy and lawrence dallaglio have never been very far away from each other throughout glittering international career even the end of his nineyear career came out of the blue just four days before the start of the season but then dallaglio has always been his own man ever since emerging onto the international scene dallaglio has polarised opinions to supporters of england dallaglio could do no wrong an integral part of sustained period of success for england dallaglio crowning glory was his part in the side that won the rugby world cup in rival fans meanwhile have tended to take an alternative view seeing dallaglio as the epitome of the less agreeable characteristics of english rugby never afraid to speak his mind be it to the referee or the opposition on the pitch or his coach or the media off it dallaglio has sometimes rubbed people up the wrong way dallaglio arrived as part of the unheralded england side which became the shock winners of the first rugby sevens world cup in it took him another two years to graduate to the full england xv but once there he proved to the manor born displaying maturity and physical power beyond his years dallaglio rapidly established himself as an automatic choice able to play any one of the three backrow positions at international standard within two years of his debut dallaglio was offered the england captain band and his career continued to go from strength to strength as he made the lions tour to south africa although overlooked for the captaincy in favour of england teammate martin johnson he played massive role in the series victory but after building up seemingly unstoppable momentum dallaglio career hit the buffers at speed in first came the lastminute defeat to wales in which dallaglio decision not to kick for goal in the dying minutes was blamed for costing england grand slam worse was to follow though as an infamous newspaper sting cost him his treasured england captaincy with sensational allegations of drug use of which he was subsequently cleared splashed across the front pages devastated dallaglio stepped down as england skipper but he bounced back getting his head down at club level before returning to the england fold albeit now as lieutenant to new captain johnson as member of newlook england side on the long road to world cup glory journey not without mishaps as succession of grand slams opportunities were spurned dallaglio emerged as key performer once again yet another setback arrived in as serious knee injury cut short dallaglio involvement on the lions tour to australia rumours began to circulate that his career was over but in typical dallaglio style he embarked on punishing schedule of rehabilitation to return an even more fearsome physical specimen one effect of the injury was to rob dallaglio of much of his pace but ever the pragmatist he reinvented himself as close quarters number eight of the highest calibre the only player to play every minute of england world cup triumph in australia dallaglio could hardly have done more to secure england historic win and for that he will always be held in the highest esteem by england supporters following johnson retirement dallaglio career came full circle as woodward restored him as england captain while england did not hit the heights in dallaglio second spell as captain losing five of their eight postworld cup tests dallaglio led by example leaving him as one of the few members of squad lacking many world cup stars to live up to expectations dallaglio walks away from the international game safe in the knowledge that he will go down as one of england most accomplished players if not one of the great captains despite his evident pride in leading his country the problem now for england is how to replace the almost irreplaceable the likes of matt dawson jonny wilkinson phil vickery and hill have all been mentioned as contenders for dallaglio role as captain but it is as player that england will really struggle to replace the yearold although players like joe worsley and chris jones are more than capable of stepping up the fact that there is no standout candidate speaks volumes about dallaglio massive influence on english rugby

breaks but agassi won the tiebreak before wrapping up win fourth seed survived an injury scare as he battled past mario ancic the russian turned his right ankle in the third game of the fourth set and documents: roche turns down federer offer australian tennis coach tony roche has turned down an approach from roger federer to be the world number one new fulltime coach say reports melbourne heraldsun said roche troubled by hip complaint did not want to travel fulltime again however roche is happy to work with the swiss star on casual basis and is helping him prepare for next month defence of his australian open crown federer has been without coach since splitting with peter lundgren in roche former davis cup player for australia won the french open reached the wimbledon and us open finals and won five wimbledon doubles titles with john newcombe he also coached former number one ivan lendl and pat rafter to grand slam victories and has worked with australia lleyton hewitt some reports claim federer initially wanted andre agassi australian coach darren cahill before agassi confirmed he would play on in federer was named swiss sportsman of the year on saturday to add to the bbc overseas sportsman and european sports journalists association awards he has already won

documents: sharapova overcomes tough molik wimbledon champion maria sharapova recovered from losing the opening set to win the final of the qatar open the second seed beat fourthseeded australian alicia molik for her second title of the year molik who had overcome top seed amelie mauresmo in friday semifinal broke sharapova in the third game of first set she went on to win but sharapova recovered to build up healthy lead in the second set and she never looked back after that molik saw her game fall apart as sharapova broke in the fifth game of the decider to lead and although molik stayed in touch sharapova held on to her serve and then finished off the match with an ace after saving break point in the th game sharapova said the key to her victory was her positive approach after losing the first set alicia was dictating terms to me in the first set but in my mind was always positive said sharapova in the first set was not playing my own game but in the second decided to put some pace on the ball and put pressure on her serve and that worked sharapova said she will head to los angeles to be with her mother and have some rest after her recent hectic schedule need some rest now and am eager to see my mum and catch up with friends after all the travelling ve been doing

for missing spain victory through injury by beating roddick to give the hosts an unassailable lead have woken up so many nights dreaming of this day said moya all my energy has been focused on today what have lived today do not think will live again spain only other davis cup title came two years ago in valencia when they beat australia and moya nicknamed charly admitted the davis cup is my dream and was bit nervous at the outset some people have said that am obsessed but think that it is better this way it helps me reach my goals if am obsessed it really incredible to get the winning point is really something spanish captain jordi arrese said charly played great game it was his opportunity and he hasn let us down he had lost three times to roddick and this was his day to beat him he had documents: federer joins alltime greats the last year has seen one player dominate men tennis and one country dominate the women game roger federer became the first man since mats wilander in to win three grand slams in one season and after anastasia myskina became the first russian woman to win grand slam at the french open two more followed at wimbledon and the us open meanwhile briton tim henman enjoyed his best year while greg rusedski fought back superbly from adversity federer began the year as world number one and holder of the wimbledon and masters cup titles and set about conquering new ground the swiss sounded warning of the dominance to come at the australian open he ripped through the draw before beating marat safin in the final andy roddick was the only player to put up any real resistance at wimbledon and federer performance against lleyton hewitt in the us open final was breathtaking federer again got the better of hewitt in the seasonending masters cup his victory in houston proved to be his th successive win in final an open era record the only major letdown was thirdround loss to gustavo kuerten at the french open and roland garros will be his main target in there was also surprise loss to the unheralded tomas berdych at the olympic games which saw chile dominate as nicoals massu took the singles and then paired up with fernando gonzaelz to win doubles gold another major trophy that looks beyond federer is the davis cup which was won by spain in home success over the usa in seville roddick struggled on the clay losing to rafael nadal on the opening day before going down to carlos moya in the allimportant fourth rubber henman broke new ground by reaching the semis on clay at the french open stunning effort and also at the us open quarterfinal defeat to mario ancic at wimbledon was disappointing for the limp manner of the briton defeat but he remains optimistic of going further next year british number two rusedski endured rollercoaster year returning to the circuit after being cleared of doping offence in march with his ranking down at many feared the yearold career was over but he battled back in the second half of the season to reenter the top the russian women finally delivered on their longrecognised promise in with myskina maria sharapova and svetlana kuznetsova winning grand slams before taking the seasonending fed cup but while the young russians were on the way up it was different story for the belgians and the williams sisters only veteran lindsay davenport held the new wave at bay stunning run of form after wimbledon taking her to number one ahead of amelie mauresmo whose grand slam drought goes on the year started in regulation fashion as justine heninhardenne beat compatriot kim clijsters at the australian open virus ruined the rest of heninhardenne year although she was fit enough to win olympic gold but clijsters had an even more miserable she suffered serious wrist injury and then announced the end of her relationship with lleyton hewitt and will be happy to see the year end in their absence myskina thrashed elena dementieva in historic but woeful allrussian final at the french open wimbledon was more refreshing affair as sharapova captivated sw showing nerves of steel as she battled past davenport and serena williams to take the title davenport was strong favourite for the us open but hampered by injury lost to the powerful and unflappable kuznetsova in the semis kuznetsova went on to give dementieva another grand slam final thrashing with the latter wayward serve becoming one of the talking points of the year with the russians still improving the likes of heninhardenne clijsters davenport mauresmo venus and serena will need to be fully fit and motivated in and it may take their compatriot safin to challenge federer on the men side

documents: hewitt survives nalbandian epic home favourite lleyton hewitt came through dramatic fiveset battle with argentine david nalbandian to reach the australian open semifinals hewitt looked to be cruising to victory after racing into twoset lead but nalbandian broke his serve three times in both of the next two sets to set up nailbiting decider hewitt eventually grabbed the vital break in the th game and served out to win and set up meeting with andy roddick the winner of that match will face either roger federer or marat safin in the final ninth seed nalbandian had never come back from two sets down to win match and there was no indication he would do so as hewitt dominated the first two sets the argentine had stoked up the temperature ahead of the match by saying hewitt exuberant oncourt celebrations were not very good for the sport and he had words with hewitt during one change of ends in the second set when the australian appeared to brush shoulders with him as they went to their chairs the balance of power changed completely in the third set as hewitt allowed his level to dip and he doublefaulted twice as nalbandian broke on the way to taking the fourth set but the tiring third seed showed incredible reserves of strength to force the break despite being outplayed for much of the final set and three times coming within two points of defeat he then produced love service game to finish off the match in four hours and five minutes just kept hanging in there it was always tough serving second in the fifth set said hewitt who had never reached the last four at his home grand slam told myself to give everything and in the end it paid off once again it a long way from holding that trophy up there but m hanging in there only four guys left that can win and we re the top four in the world it set up for pretty good showdown in the semis and finals

documents: gb players warned over security britain davis cup players have been warned not to go out of their tel aviv hotel unaccompanied ahead of the weekend tie against israel suicide bombing in nightclub in the city on friday claimed four victims we spoke about the bomb and we were told that we must not leave the hotel on our own andrew murray told the daily telegraph jeremy bates gb captain told us to be careful when we go out of the hotel and not to do anything stupid but murray insisted that the team which also includes greg rusedski arvind parmar david sherwood and reserve alex bogdanovic has been able to concentrate on the task ahead the bomb went off just few miles from where we are staying said yearold murray will try not to think about what happened but don think it will have any effect on the british team concentration we will be safe if we stay in the hotel and the tennis centre speaking on saturday team captain bates said it was terrible thing very unfortunate thing but think that sport must go on think that there are lot of people involved in this event who have obviously taken great care to make sure the event runs smoothly an lta statement said we have every confidence in the organisation and security of this tie we will continue to monitor the situation carefully the team arrived in tel aviv on saturday and practised on the hard courts at the ramat hasharon arena on sunday

documents: henman murray claim lta awards tim henman was named player of the year for by the lawn tennis association at wimbledon on monday the briton was recognised for the best year of his career which saw him reach the semis at the french and us opens scotland andrew murray was named young player of the year after winning the us open juniors as well as futures event in italy and world number one peter norfolk won disabled player of the year after claiming his third us open crown great britain under boys won the team of the year prize for their victory at the world junior tennis event in august henman will start his campaign at the kooyong event on january in field that includes roger federer andy roddick and andre agassi and the briton is optimistic of surpassing his best effort of fourthround place at the australian open which begins the following week ve often felt that the conditions suit my game in melbourne so d love to be able to start next year by doing well at the australian open henman told his website that why ve changed my schedule slightly by committing to play in the kooyong classic ll be able to acclimatise while practising before the event and then will be guaranteed matches against the best players in the world think that will give me the best possible chance of doing well at the australian open

brightest tennis hopes in the months and possibly years to come the american legend swept into london on thursday to announce longterm relationship with the lawn tennis association after spending three days at the elite performance winter camp in la manga and the man who epitomised the phrase will to win before lleyton hewitt was even born is clear about the qualities he hopes to convey you know everybody hits the ball well and there a very fine line between number one and number said connors was that fine line for long time but if can help want to be part of teaching kids how to win connors is not the first great name to offer his services to the lta his longtime rival john mcenroe has repeatedly done the same but connors is at pains to point out that his interest goes well beyond any publicity stunt and he gave glowing recommendation to the work of lta performance director david felgate and his team britain has different attitude the right attitude in taking the game forward and finding the next wimbledon champion said connors that something you don find every day everybody talks good game but not everybody puts that into effect the impression came away with after just seeing david and the other coaches for three days was one like ve never seen before especially over here this is not going to happen overnight there are no miracle workers but you re going in the right direction the yearold enthusiasm for the work going on in this country is in marked contrast to his relationship with tennis officials back in america ve had discussions with the usta united young players if they re chosen they ve got to produce he said if not someone will come and take their place there only one number one spot and it lonely up there but it got the best view in the year that has seen andrew murray emerge as britain great new hope connors rejected suggestions that the scot might be put under too much pressure too soon tim henman has whole country on his shoulder said the american surely cannot turn things around now nadal works roddick around the court on two consecutive points to earn two break points one is enough the spaniard secures the doublebreak and roddick
